For a hotel at this level, I expected better room service, and I simply did not get that. I checked in on Saturday through Tuesday checkout. The room was not serviced Sunday or Monday, my fault I was told to ask for the service. I asked for it Tuesday morning because we extend our stay until Saturday morning. The service was horrible, the room was barely touched. I went downstairs and complained , they said I have to ask for full service, I got a refresh. I asked for full service on Tuesday and it was good. Then the hotel called me and said we will clean the room every other day which meant Thursday. There was no cleaning on Wednesday, Thursday and Friday. Again I have been a Marriott member for 24 years, never saw such incompetence. Save your money and get a lower cost room

Summary Heading: Family holiday in a hotel catering mainly to its private sports club members and business guests.
Summary: Stayed here on vacation with friends and family for 5 nights.  First impressions - nice large lobby and entrance area with amazing sports facilities and gym.   What’s bad  Service is not as you’d expect for the price you pay - it’s slow and not very friendly . First impressions last and it doesn’t cost anyone to be nice . Maybe staff aren’t happy etc.  Parking is $27 per day Internet - hidden additional charges at $10 per day (had this removed from bill) Housekeeping by request only and not guaranteed . For the room rate this is not acceptable.  Pool looks great with designated lanes for laps but it is not clean (in my 5 days I took out 2 plasters and a half dead bird) and in my stay I never saw it being cleaned nor did I see anyone monitor cleanliness of water Bar closes at

Summary Heading: If I'm being charged nearly $300 a night as a solo guest then I expect...
Summary: On checking out and reviewing my bill it seems my hotel charge per night went up each night.  Given I wasn't entitled to any room cleaning services and I attach pictures of the state of the room when I checked in and I was in the room as a solo guest. So I have no idea how they can justify the cost going up every night for 0 changes/enhancements etc.  This hotel is not inclusive of any meals drinks so I had those charges on top of the room fees hence I would expect my hotel room to be flawless.  The bed mattresses clearly have been worn down by other guests body pressure and was not supportive for my back so I had to position myself in the middle. This is one of two hotels in this specific region and I presume they both know that guests don't have any choice but to stay with one

This property is located in a quiet business park with an attached health club.  It looks nice from the entrance and a loud bar scene is the focus of the lobby.  This could be a nice property with new textiles and furniture.  The existing rooms are in loud colors with rugged built-to-last furniture and a bland bathroom.  The closet door was replaced with a curtain.    No housekeeping service.  It was quiet during the night.  We will look elsewhere next time.
Room tip: Quiet at night if you need to sleep.

Summary Heading: Embarassing to call this a Renaissance
Summary: The only thing similar to other Renaissance properties is the Aveda bathroom shampoo, conditioner, and soap.    The lobby has promise then you get in the elevator, and it goes downhill.  It has a college dorm feel, and the rooms are worse.  Old furniture, cushions on the chairs that don't even match the chair.  It's dirty and beat up. The bathroom tiles are stained and dirty and the carpets have stains.  The people at the front desk were pleasant.  Cannot in good conscience recommend this place.

Summary Heading: Caters More to Club Members than Hotel Guests
Summary: I wanted to like this property but really didn't.  Our room was clean and adequate for 2 nights.  It is in a mostly business area without restaurants nearby.   I think what I disliked most was that this is a combination local Gym/Swim Club combined with a hotel for out of town guests.  So the pools, for instance, catered to the club members.  In the large pool, only a very small portion was sectioned off for hotel guests.  The rest were swim lanes for members.  The smaller pool had an exercise class going on it - definitely not for us.  Although I think you could get access to classes for an additional fee. There is also a kids pool which we had no interest in.   Parking was in a garage across the road (which had very little traffic) but still involved a walk to get your car.

Summary Heading: Dirty room, stale smoke smells, worse than a Motel 6
Summary: I cannot believe how different this place is from what they advertise, zero staff for customer service, no staff at bar or poolside, i could not wait to leave here everything is overpriced and the rooms are old and dingy, it was smoky and the sheets and carpet were stainee

Appalling service. People with an attitude. Rooms are not cleaned. Food is terrible. Great Business trip in March somehow spoiled by this place and crew. Avoid at all cost. Rooms are dirty and you wonder when was the last time a proper house cleaning happened.

Summary Heading: Amazing fitness center/pool and wonderful staff!!
Summary: Wow! Amazing fitness center and outdoor lap pool with sunning area. Staff were amazing!! So attentive to guests needs- everyone really was great. I will single out Jaime as superbly helpful and courteous - the best of the best. Rooms were spacious and up to date. Clean and comfortable. Only negative was the high cost of parking $27 per day and this is an industrial area not in the middle of downtown. Didn’t like that but otherwise would definitely stay here again for the excellent service and we really enjoyed the pool, fitness center and outdoor dining. Very convenient to San Juan Capistrano and Laguna Beach.

Summary Heading: Unique property that combines a top-notch health club and a hotel
Summary: This hotel is unlike any other that I have stayed at.  It is combined with a world-class health club featuring an outstanding weight room, cardio machine collection, gym, class facilities, spinning classes, pool, steam, sauna, whirlpool, etc.  Guests at the hotel have the use of all of these facilities, although there are many club members from the surrounding communities. The hotel is about 15 minutes from Laguna Beach, and makes a great base of operations for visiting that area, without paying the exorbitant prices of beachside hotels. I had stayed here for business three or four time, and finally brought my family hear for a vacation.  My wife and to college-age sons, who are all fitness enthusiasts, make great use of the facilities, and loved it.  Post-covid, dining,

It's a fair priced facility within easy distance of a number of shops. The gym was very good and well equipped. Due to Covid some of the equipment can be used outside in the parking lot - a good idea as it reduces the density inside. Room was good and I had no complaints.

We spent the weekend and had a great stay. Robert checked us in and made us feel welcome. With their COVID protocols we felt safe and had no issues. The staff was friendly, professional and cared about our comfort. Robert was our favorite. He would stop what he was doing and ask us how we were doing.  He was a pleasure to deal with. He was very customer oriented and even at check out came outside to thank us for our stay and wish us safe travels.  We look forward to seeing Robert on our next stay as we will be back.

This hotel is part of a full service health club. Lots of options for active people including basketball courts, racket ball, spin classes and a large weight area. Outdoor includes 3 pools with lap pool and 2 hot tubs. The room I had on the 3rd floor over looked the pool and was quite noisy until after 11 pm.

Kinda nice.   The room was nice, the beds were comfortable. Service was excellent! Maids very nice and attentive. I could tell the place is well run!  I am surprised that this is not a higher level property, 3.5.  Had a quick lunch first day and breakfast second day. Very pleasant and reasonably priced, again, great service! Good management. Summary: Well, for a 4 star hotel this one does a bare minimum. There aren’t many good places to eat in the vicinity if any, and restaurant at the hotel is kind of your average airport restaurant (not good, just average) with minimal personality and somewhat acceptable food. Room service menu is very small, wine list non existent, there is no mini bar and no even snacks. Good luck if you are hungry late at night. If you are planning to stay for more than one night, do yourself a favor and find a better hotel even if it is further away.

We ate downstairs in the Citrus Fresh Grill and has two of the Best Cosmos ever along with wings and Brussels Sprouts with bacon!! Delicious!! Outstanding service from Emily! A wonderful stay in the OC!

Summary Heading: Great for solo travel- probably not for families with young kids
Summary: Stayed here and was impressed with the gym, pool and indoor basketball court.  Best gym facilities of any hotel I’ve been at.   The hotel bar was nice and service great. The rooms were clean but full sized beds- not queen.  I would t recommend this for families.  There was no fridge in room.  I was there with a teen basketball team and we wanted to bring a pizza in and eat outside but your not allowed to have any outside food in common areas so that was a bummer.   Great location.  Nice service.  Nice hotel and I’d stay again— but not with kids
Manager Response: Dear Kimberly85044,  Thank you for staying at Renaissance ClubSport Aliso Viejo Laguna Beach Hotel. We appreciate your business and look forward to seeing you on your next trip to this area.  Michael Robby Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed for two days as a family of four on vacation visiting family and Disneyland. The room was ok, but were were assigned a king room for a family of four, but the hotel provided a roll away bed for one child and the other had to sleep in the king bed, so it was a little crowded. They were sold out of rooms with two beds, so we could not move to another room. The staff comped our parking for this inconvenience. We booked a room which included breakfast, which was a very good value, considering the quality of the breakfast. The breakfast buffet included an omelette station, smoked salmon, fresh fruit and fresh juices. We also took advantage of the amazing Southern California winter sun and enjoyed the pools, hot tub and kids water play area. I also took a class at the gym,

Summary: An excellent and beautiful hotel, with all the right amenities, for business (or pleasure). Plus, a high end sports club that is part of the room fee; putting a lot of other clubs to shame with the equipment and staff, not to mention all the classes.  The bar, and restaurant have a great vibe, and probably the BEST fish tacos I have ever had (get them blackened!) if you like soft shell.  Their outdoor pools are large and lovely, with plenty of seating for when the sun shines brightly, even in the winter!  Agnes in particular stands out for Marriott: "our guests are the MOST important thing about our property, and we are here to help them enjoy their experience."  She does this with grace, as do her other colleagues all around the building.    If you have a choice of places to

Thank you again for your feedback, and we look forward to welcoming you back whenever you are in this area.  Michael Robby Assistant General Manager

Summary: Probably the best hotel I have stayed in. Service was great. My room and key was ready before arrival so check in took like 30 seconds. All amenities I asked for were already in the room. Two pools and a jacuzzi. Not too far from the beaches either. Starbucks on property with great smoothies. Will definitely stay here again

Michael Robby Assistant General Manager

Summary: What an impressive hotel, complemented by great service too.  My family and I arrived really late (1 A.M.) and the staff were so gracious from the moment we arrived. They mistakenly assigned us to the wrong room but were very quick to resolve the issue as soon as I called reception to report the problem (5 minutes after my call, a new room key was delivered to us!).   Our room was very impressive: spacious, sophisticated, clean, functional and most of all, the beds were VERY comfortable.   The only disappointing thing about our stay was the fact that we weren't able to use any of the gym facilities or the pool.  The fitness center was ALWAYS busy!  The hotel is also conveniently located - a short drive from the freeway exit and just a few minutes away from John Wayne

Summary: 11AM on my day of arrival I get an email notifying me that they have overbooked and would kindly cover my expenses at another local hotel.  I didn’t want another hotel...the whole reason I booked the room was to get access to the gym and having that convenience.  Additionally a colleague of mine booked after me and was not booted out of her reservation.  I will never stay at this hotel again..it’s a basic hotel with a nice gym attached.
Manager Response: Dear 13AdamT,   Thank you for the review of your experience at our hotel. We are very sorry you were unable to stay with us this time and for the inconvenience caused. Summary: We didn’t know quite what to expect at this hotel but found the friendliest, most courteous service from valets to reception to restaurant and room service. Absolutely excellent in every way. Our room was immaculate. Room service breakfast was delicious— and the bar/restaurant downstairs had a fantastic outdoor terrace which was perfect for meeting friends and family for drinks. Emily in the bar is a delight!

We are thrilled to read your comments about the great service you received from our staff and how they exceeded your expectations. Please be assured we will pass on your comments to Emily. It was our pleasure to serve you, and we hope to have you back with us again in the near future!  Michael Robby Assistant General Manager

Summary: I was here for only one night & it was for business but it did leave with a nice impression of the experience.  The one thing that really shines here are the employees. Front the happy faces of the bakers who opened the door for me to the smiles that checked me in at he front desk, just my arrival was memorable.  I arrived really early and they were kind enough to accommodate me so I could go to my new room, unpack & go straight to the pool.  The hotel has a nice lap pool, nice and cool and I spent a couple of hours just wading in it.  In the evening, I went to the Citrus Bar & enjoyed some good drinks & a flat bread pizza that was prepared nicely with ample toppings & cracker crisp crust.  The only part I wished was a feature here is perhaps a sundry store to get little last

Summary Heading: Best Fitness Center Ever at a Great Hotel
Summary: This is an excellent hotel.  The fitness center is as good as you will ever get at a hotel.  The restaurant is also excellent (rice bowl with coconut rice and blackened chicken was yummy).  Staff was wonderful.  Rooms are very comfortable and modern with a great bed and shower.  Location is great.  If you are coming to this area, this is the place to stay - when considering all of the features of the hotel  with so many great amenities you can't beat it.
Manager Response: Dear Shev61,  Thank you for your fantastic review of the Renaissance ClubSport Aliso Viejo Laguna Beach Hotel. Summary: Title says it all really - website showed incorrect breakfast price (I took a screen shot of website post prior to arriving) which I highlighted to the front desk lady.  x2 occasions I had to wait at the front deception desk for a staff member to appear - not sure why they are leaving it unattended when there are two desks that I presume should be serving guests; no safe in room; no fridge in room; nothing to make a decent cup of tea with (just a U.S assumption that all guests drink coffee).  Only reason I'd return is its close proximity to my brothers home.
Manager Response: Dear Blackbutterflai,   We truly appreciate your feedback and thank you for being our guest. Summary: I love this hotel particularly because of the impressive gym it has.  It is even better than the gym I have membership to.  The hotel gym was clean and the machines look brand new.  They provide strawberry, cucumber, and orange waters along with towels.  The hotel gym also has a spa which included a hot pool, sauna, and steam room besides shower stalls.  My son used the basketball and racquetball courts with his friends and they also looked clean.  Besides the gym, the hotel itself is also great.  My room was very roomy, and I liked the shower with Aveda products (though I feel there could have been more toiletry amenities).  The bed was comfortable, though the king comforter felt a bit heavy.  There are only 6 floors to the hotel so it felt intimate even though it offered so

It is also great to know you enjoyed your spacious guest room with all the modern features. Thanks for allowing us to be of service, and we look forward to your next visit.  Michael Robby Assistant General Manager

Summary: Imagine a giant modern  fitness center connected to a beautiful state of the art Hotel.   There you have it. Great hotel great pools with kiddie areas.   Awesome time for everyone.   Spent two relaxing days at the pool.  The pool good servers were on point and constantly walking around and everything was spotless.

Summary: DO NOT STAY HERE! This hotel has the worst customer service I have ever experienced. Let me preface this by saying I’ve never left a negative review on Trip Advisor & I’m a 20 year Marriott Rewards member so I’m usually of fan of their brand of hotels. That being said, we had a nightmare experience at the Renaissance’s ClubSport Hotel. We checked in on July 6th at 8:30 pm. We went to our room & it was HOT! The AC wasn’t working so we called the front desk. They said they would send somebody up...no one came for an hour. We called again. They promised to send someone up AGAIN. Still no one came. Finally I went down to the lobby & this is when informed us that a majority of the properties AC wasn’t working. NICE! They said it probably wouldn’t be until the next day. It took 2

Summary: Stuck in traffic, we called the hotel to ensure that our cousin could check-in prior to our arrival. Her name was on the reservation. My cousin checked-in with the manager on duty Elizabeth Lister, who basically told our cousin that she would need to make her own reservation and her name was not on the reservation. Furthermore, she raised her voice at our cousin and refused to call us to confirm what our cousin had stated. My cousin was treated like a second class citizen, with absolutely no customer service from Elizabeth Lister. Discrimination and rude behavior is inexcusable for this national hotel chain. I would give “0” stars. Checking in to a Hilton or Hyatt or other hotel chain in the future. Shame on you, Renaissance ClubSport in Aliso Viejo.

Summary Heading: The gym is all that matters here
Summary: I love this hotel, simply because of the attached gym. There is a very pretty Marriott on the beach not that far away for about the same price, but if you’re traveling for business and want to get a workout in, this place is fantastic! They have an extreme fitness room, basketball, racquetball, and lots of group classes. I wish the gym stayed open later, and my hotel room was a little outdated/not as elegant for the price. However, the gym made up for it, and I even had a set of baby weights in my room.   Even the cafe downstairs was health oriented and offered various protein options. I’m definitely going to stay in this hotel every time I travel to this area!
Manager Response: Dear jleung2213,  Thank you for your feedback about the Renaissance ClubSport Aliso Viejo Laguna Beach Hotel. Summary: My fiancé and I stayed for three nights over Memorial Day weekend. The property/hotel concept was really cool and unique and though we’re not fitness buffs, we loved the bright colors and vibe. Most importantly, we experienced awesome service from the staff and really appreciated their helpfulness and friendliness on a very busy weekend for them. We will be back!
Manager Response: Dear Colleen W,  Thank you for your pleasant review and for all the wonderful things that you had to say about Renaissance ClubSport Aliso Viejo Laguna Beach Hotel. Thanks again for your feedback, and we look forward to having you stay with us again.  Julio Garneff General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but there are better options
Summary: We stayed at the Renaissance Club Sport on a business trip to Aliso Viejo. The hotel was pre paid for us, so we have no idea what it cost. However, I would venture to guess it isn’t cheap. There are not many hotels in Aliso, so you’re limited if you need to be right in this area. If you don’t, it may be worth the drive to stay somewhere else, either in Mission Viejo, or Dana Point/San Clemente if you want to be closer to the beach.   The hotel is nice but it’s not mind blowing. It’s pretty standard. The gym is the standout if you like to exercise while you travel. It honestly feels more like a gym that happens to have a hotel attached.

Summary: This was a beautiful Hotel !  Very clean and the entire hotel smells great!  Very kid friendly! Attached to awesome fitness center. Nice Olympic pool and pool for kids. Nice pool bar and onsite restaurant. The staff provides excellent customer service and greet you with smiles!

Then the guy says, we are basically a health club with a hotel attached. Traveling on business, I didn’t have time to use their health club, but the WiFi is free which is nice. The room is quiet, basic and doesn’t even have a fridge. I can’t remember the last time that I was in a hotel room without one. The bathroom was nice and had good lighting. I grabbed a coffee from the deli in the morning and had room service one night. Both are quick and good. Overall a good stay and would recommend it. It’s nice to be able to work out in an amazing gym as opposed to a converted guest room with three treadmills for a change.  The facilities are awesome. I expected a brochure with a map of this special "ClubSport" resort with all their amenities or at least the wi-fi code but we weren't offered one.  We were there for a conference and while in session, the employees who worked it were fabulous!  They kept the rooms we used well stocked, clean, and were very helpful and courteous.  However....being a very busy weekend for them, it seemed they were understaffed and overwhelmed in their food/drink service departments.  On Saturday night a group of us went out to sit in the patio around the firepit and have a drink. Summary Heading: Comfortable accommodations in a health club atmosphere.
Summary: This Marriott property is adjacent to a fitness center and has a full restaurant and bar.  It's a newer hotel and offers comfortable, attractive rooms.  The overall style is very modern and trendy.  While more of a business hotel, it is still only about 20-30 minutes to many tourist attractions such as Laguna Beach and Newport Beach.  There are many restaurants and a theatre nearby.  There is a $19 per night parking fee or $25 per night for valet.  We didn't use the pool or gym, but both looked very nice.  Had breakfast in the restaurant and it was expensive and not very good.  I would eat elsewhere.

Summary: If you are the sort of traveller that enjoys a workout when travelling then you are in luck.  The Renaissance is attached to a major commercial gym & as hotel guests have access one could say that it probably the best hotel gym on the planet. I certainly enjoyed this facility, which is very high quality. However the hotel it’s self is fairly average. It is your standard small town business hotel. The rooms are decent sized, the bed relatively comfortable and the staff pretty good. Most of the guests here are probably on business as there really isn’t much in the town to see or do and it a perfectly acceptable business hotel

Summary: This hotel is an outstanding choice for business or pleasure.  A great location with an outstanding fitness center you have access too. The pool area is fabulous as well. As a Platinum Marriott member received complimentary breakfast and it was excellent for the entire Stay. The bar  area at night was lively and a great place to wind down.

Summary Heading: Beautifully designed hotel with amazing pool and gym
Summary: I went to this hotel with a party of 3, and we stayed in room overlooking the pool area. The hotel is very sports oriented, my son swam in the full size pool and really enjoyed it, there are 3 different jacuzzis, one outside and one in each locker room. There is also a family pool in addition to the lap pool. The lounge area is very beautiful and the eating area outside for the grill also has an amazing setup and comfortable feeling. The gym area is very big and the treadmills overlook the pool area. Overall a very enjoyable stay however the hotel is in the middle of a business area, but Laguna Beach is definitely worth the 15 minute drive from the hotel as the view at the beach is gorgeous. If you are on the way to San Diego, this one is a good choice to spend the night.
Manager Response: Dear Mike H,  Thank you for staying with us here at the Renaissance ClubSport Hotel, near Laguna Beach.  We really like to showcase these kind of reviews as they very nicely illustrate the "resort-like" atmosphere that we have tried very hard to create at our special hotel here in Aliso Viejo.  Our family-friendly amenities even include a kids Splash 'n Play area, which is a very delightful space, similar to what one might find at much larger resorts or even amusement parks.  The best part of all is that here at Renaissance ClubSport there is no resort fee, no health club fees, nor any destination fee - which you'll find at almost all comparable hotels in places like Newport Beach and Dana Point.  Really makes us a one-of-a-kind deal for families looking for a weekend getaway in close proximity to Laguna Beach.  Hope to see you again soon,  Michael Robby Director of Hotel Sales Renaissance ClubSport michael.robby@clubsports.com

Summary: Unfortunately, I only stayed here one night but I will definitely come back when I am in area! This is more of a resort-style hotel than a regular hotel. The room was well appointed, bright, stylish, and very clean. And the bed and pillows made for a very restful sleep!  The gym is unlike any other hotel gym you will see. In fact, it can probably rival many local gyms!  The restaurant is a cool hangout, serves good food an has a good wine list. The breakfast buffet is excellent and always well stocked. The service in the restaurant is also excellent; attentive without being obtrusive.  I would also like to acknowledge Jose, the valet guy. He was very helpful, polite and courteous. He just made me feel very welcome. I really wish I could have spent more time here. I will plan

Summary Heading: Be prepared to become a gym snob
Summary: The renaissance fitness center is like no other.  I have been a member since it opened. I travel a lot including living in other places for temporary periods. I have no found a gym, club, restaurant, bar like this anywhere! The facilities are top notch. The instructors are the best.  The vibe is all around upbeat and you don’t want to leave.  It is very difficult to match this club.

Summary Heading: The best relax and exercise combo hotel
Summary: I have stayed here a few times. The hotel is fabulous especially if you like to exercise daily. The gym is clean and well equipped and the pool is outdoor and heated. The juice bar is great pre and post workout. The rooms are spacious and clean. The disappointing thing is the restaurant on this trip. Overpriced, understaffed and waiters inexperienced, not very bright nor very accommodating....they brought down the quality of the experience  immensely. Needs to be rehauled azap.

I had to book a hotel near my 10k event; which is less than 50 miles from where I live.  Southern California has a ton of great hotels; but so far this is the best one I've ever stayed at.  Renaissance is my choice Marriott brand; and this one did not disappoint.  Three words: Adult Pool area.  There's a family-friendly pool area with its own jacuzzi; and the adult side have their own.  There's a lap pool; the gym is large for a hotel so right away that's very impressive.  There's a basketball court, and a fitness class room separate from the elliptical/treadmill/weights area.    The restaurant is small, but the patio area is amazing with firepits, etc.  The food choices are fresh and healthy.  There's tons of parking (pay), and they offer valet as well I believe.  My Marriott

Summary Heading: Great property, great workout facilities, pools, nice restaurant
Summary: I'm a frequent Marriott customer and this property really impressed me.  It has nice rooms and bathrooms.  It has a tremendous health club with 3 pools, a top of the line locker room.  Huge selection of exercise facilities, basketball courts, raquetball courts, etc.  The staff was very friendly.  We ate at the Citrius Grill restaurant several times and they had a limited menu, but everything was very good.  The only downside is the silly valet parking for $25 a day which seems like overkill.  Would highly recommend this property.

Summary Heading: Great comfort in the middle of an office and industrial complex
Summary: What a find.....who da thunk it? Wildly modern and convenient especially to the Mission Viejo Country Club. Huge complex - it has almost everything.Hotel staff VERY cordial and accommodating.....and close to the Country Club where we attended a fabulous wedding. Room was large and comfortable...view not so much but we were only there one night.

I stayed at this hotel because it is close where a new employee I hired lives. I was really looking forward to utilizing the work out facilities.  Unfortunately I broke my ankle (long story) the morning I checked in, so no gym time.   The staff and front desk went way out of their way to make sure I was comfortable.  They went so far to have warm cookies and milk brought to my room!  It was very nice!  Thank you Jocelyn and Louis!  Nice room, large shower.    Food was good.  I had their burger and then the rice bowl.  Both were outstanding.    I will stay here again

Summary: I've never stayed at a Renaissance ClubSport hotel before, but I will plan on seeking this hotel for future business trips! This hotel was a fabulous hotel and made it very convenient in visiting my client which was within walking distance. This hotel has one of the best hotel gyms that I have ever been to. Full size basketball courts, racquet ball courts, spinning classes, yoga classes, and fitness classes. There are many free weights as well as tons of cardio equipment! There is a full spa as well as individual mens/women's locker rooms that include: whirlpool, steam room, sauna and closed in shower areas. There is a full size lap pool for swimming as well as a smaller pool and kiddie pool. I spent all my free time in working out at the gym and then attending cycle spinning
Manager Response: Dear thetravelman49,  Thank you for the great review and honest feedback as well.  We strive for excellence for each guest here at the Renaissance ClubSport Hotel, near Laguna Beach - especially our dedicated business travelers.  We'll certainly share the nice comments and also these couple opportunity areas where we can improve / be more consistent.  That said, we'd be delighted to comp your next meal in the Citrus Grill and your valet parking as well, as our way of saying "thanks" - we appreciate the business and your loyalty to Renaissance.  Sincerely,  Michael Robby Director of Hotel Sales Renaissance ClubSport Hotels michael.robby@clubsports.com

Summary: We were here because we came up from San Diego for the Pageant of the Masters which was lots of fun.   It is very close by.    Three pools and one was Olympic sized.  Grounds nicely landscaped.  All details attended to here.  Cool lamps in the room.  Aveda bath products.  Neat alarm clock.  Shower head was one of those cool ones that are high up with the water coming straight down.  The lobby and bar upscale. Very cool fixtures and adornments.   Service was excellent and friendly.  Parking garage close to the room.  Didn't use the fitness center, but sure was fabulous!  Lots of Laguna Beach wives using it on Monday morning.    Things we didn't love.  AC only went to 68 and was not cold enough.  Booked the room using Marriott points and parking was not comped and was $19.  (I

Well located, rooms are spotless clean and most important these days.. The internet connexion seems to work just fine..so far..  The gym is amazing they have all the tool you need to keep in shape. Also the pools are perfect and of course the California temperature help liking all this ;-)

I've been coming to this hotel for years for work trips and it's always been great. The people are the front desk are always very nice, accommodating and are helpful when you need transportation.   The Citrus Grill at the hotel has a great menu and they have awesome outdoor seating with fire pits which is a great way to wind down the day. Service can be a bit slow outside but it's not a big deal.  The gym and pool are also really nice and not too packed in the AM and great amenities to use while there.  The only compliant is that there isn't a mini fridge in the room but apparently you can call the front desk and they'll bring you one. They do this to save energy from what I understand so I can't argue with that.

This place is amazing. The only hesitancy to write a review is fear this place will get too busy. We just had an amazing vacation, with our children, at this hotel. What other vacation can you go to where you work out everyday and feel healthier than when you checked-in! We will absolutely be back. The staff, service, accommodation, location - everything was perfect.

We stayed here for the weekend during my daughter's soccer tournament in the area. The rooms are well appointed. The beds are a tad small (2 double beds, rather than 2 queen beds), but very comfortable, which made up for the small size.  The check in process was easy, with warm and courteous staff. Onsite self parking was easy and only a few minutes walk to the lobby. The breakfast buffet was excellent.   There was one significant issue we encountered: On the first night there, we had dinner on the outdoor patio, under a cabana/gazebo cover. We were 12 adults, and it was perfect. The following night, even though some of us were considering going out to a restaurant in the area for dinner, we decided to return to the same place at the hotel for dinner. While the other soccer

As a customer service representative for a local water district I would like to say that Jocelyn Hales, Sabrina Beck and Gabriella Williams at the front desk are the embodiment of a true business representative that is truly looking out for the customer experience and is always willing to help in any situation possible!! Also Amber Sinkinson and Marcus Alvarez  are fantastic bar servers they are always looking after patrons of this establishment  and I can honestly say the crew here ROCKS!!!!

This hotel is perfect for families with young kids.  We have a 23 month old and he had so much fun!  We lived the kiddie pools and the water slides.  The hotel has everything you need.  My husband used the gym and I used the whirlpool and the steam room.  The facilities are clean and well equipped.  What made our stay even better was the service from the staff, especially the pool staff.  They were all very friendly and accommodating.  I used to work for the Four Seasons, so I'm a hotel snob when it comes to service and cleanliness.  The only negative thing we experienced was I found a spider in our bed.  Otherwise, it would have been a 5 star stay and we'll definitely be back!

This is a fitness enthusiast's delight. The facilities here make staying at a hotel more fun than others. The ClubSport side of the hotel is massive, well kept and offers plenty of activities from indoor basketball, volleyball, lap swimming, steam room, sauna, jacuzzis, etc. It was a bit difficult to check-out. My only feedback for improvement is the restaurant on site. It was very difficult finding an open seat on a Friday evening and it took a while to flaf down a server once seated. Also, the blueberry protein shake offered at the juice bar needs a recipe flavor reinvention. All staff are wonderful, friendly and cheerful. I would definitely stay again for the fitness atmosphere experience.

Summary Heading: It's close to family, that's about it
Summary: For the second time staying at this hotel I had to go down to the front desk and request toilet paper and kleenex. How does housekeeping not notice a freshly cleaned room is running out of these staples? Also, when I fell into bed--late--to watch some TV I discovered the TV remote was missing. Who should make sure this is in place?? At least the front desk sent someone up with one, as late as it was, but really, this is a first (and terribly annoying to debate whether or not to tip the deliverer). On the positive side, the young men at the valet station are unfailingly polite and helpful, even if you are self parking your car. The front desk clerk, who turned out to be a manager, was also friendly and remembered my elderly mom and me.
Manager Response: Dear CramerWashstate,  Greetings from the management team of the Renaissance ClubSport Hotel, here at the Aliso Viejo / Laguna Beach location.  We thank you for staying with us and for sharing this important feedback.  I can assure you, we are following up with our operational teams to ensure this is addressed, as these standard guestroom amenities should always be consistently refreshed on a daily basis.  The service culture of Renaissance Hotels is what drives us here - to continually strive to take great care of our members and guests.  That said, it definitely seems we could have done better for you on this last stay.  We are glad to hear the good comments about the valet and Hotel Front Desk teams - we will share that feedback as well.  If we can make this up to you on your next trip to this location, perhaps with a nice complimentary upgrade, please let us know and it's my pleasure to offer personal assistance in advance of your next stay.  Thanks for choosing Renaissance Hotels,  Michael Robby Director of Hotel Sales Renaissance ClubSport michael.robby@clubsports.com

Summary: We travel as a family of 4 (parents and our 2 kids ages 6 and 8) and we stayed here for two nights checking out on Easter Sunday. Although we don't spend our time in a hotel room while traveling, we need extra space when we are in the room. As a Marriott Platinum member, we always have been accommodated by various properties but for some reason not at this hotel. Cramped accommodations, as we were given a King room. Our 6-year old slept on the tiny couch while my son slept on a rollaway. Very small room and we requested an upgrade and was denied with an old tired excuse that they were fully booked. Larger rooms and suites were still on offer as available on the hotel’s website. Tweeted to Renaissance corporate and they responded 2 days later, on the checkout day, that our

From the standpoint of how we are presenting the hotel to charitable organizations, etc. we would like to get more information on the certificate you purchased and how that was transacted prior to your hotel stay.  We would welcome the chance to speak with you and also try to make this up to you on a future stay, if we can.  Your loyalty to Marriott and Renaissance Hotels is important to us, and we will strive to find solutions for you, moving forward in your travels.  Sincerely,  Michael Robby Director of Hotel Sales

Summary Heading: It's okay - not a lot of choices in the area
Summary: I was visiting someone at Mission Hospital in nearby Mission Viejo (two stops south on the 73 toll road) and needed a place to stay for the evening. There are not a lot of choices in the area, so I decided to give Renaissance ClubSport a try. It's pretty much a business hotel and since it was a holiday weekend, there was plenty of availability.  I will start with the good.  The bathroom was really nice -- fairly spacious, clean, very modern look and large walk in shower.    The buffet breakfast was a bit pricey at $24, but I liked the made to order omelet station and I appreciated that they had local organic spinach for the omelet. (Do have to say though that the breakfast potatoes on the buffet line were disgusting and seemed to have come straight from the frozen food section

Summary: We were gone all day and the housekeeper showed up at 5:30 to clean.  Told her we were getting ready to go out and she'd have to return in 30 minutes - every 10 minutes she's knocking at the door.  Same late cleaning the next evening (not day) and I went to use a washcloth (that was supposed to be clean) was dirty - not stained, dirty left a clean.  My profile requests foam pillows and extra towels - also stated on my reservation - didn't happen all 3 days (nor did it happen the last stay a few months ago either).  Get it together housekeeping staff.  This is not Marriott quality by far.  Too many choices in the area, will start going elsewhere.

Summary Heading: For people who r dieting or r vegetarians
Summary: Food left a lot to be desired and choices for dinner were not very numerous, seemed geared to people who had just worked out! Staff quite helpful.  Many people from outside using various facilities, mostly young and hanging out after class! Parking for guests of the hotel not free.

Here at the Renaissance ClubSport Hotel, near Laguna Beach, we are constantly looking to make our guest's culinary experience as memorable as we can.  We try our best to work with guests, and our Chefs, to create special requests and food which inspires and delights.  At our signature Citrus Grill, our Executive Chef Juan Navarette has created a new and improved 2017 menu with some exciting changes.  That said, we always love to create something special per our guests request.  Let us know what you are looking for, and we can likely do something that will amaze you on your next visit.  Hope to see you again here at the Renaissance ClubSport Hotel  Sincerely,  Michael Robby Director of Hotel Sales michael.robby@clubsports.com

Summary: As other reviews have stated, it is a very busy place.  Half the building is health club so if that is important to you I don't know if you can find a better one, it is huge.  Hotel rooms were average Marriott quality type of room.  Lobby is like a train station.  Lots of action, very noisy, there is bar, cafe, entrance to gym, coffee bar etc.  Not a big deal but this is not a quiet place. Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Would stay again depending on other options in the area.  Price was kind of high but it could just be the area, so value is just so-so.   Clean and adequate for business travel.  Valet or self park you have to pay FYI.
Manager Response: Dear TropicalTraveler78,  Thank you for staying with us here at the Renaissance ClubSport Hotel, near Laguna Beach. We appreciate your feedback in our quest to offer the best service and hotel accommodations in this area.  It appears we did some things very well during your visit, including the amazing fitness offering in ClubSport, which is offered to all hotel guests at no additional charge.  This includes unlimited group fitness classes, a 12,000 sq ft fitness floor with all the latest and best equipment, locker rooms which feature wet and dry saunas, hot tub and an expansive aquatic center. We like to call it the "fitness resort" experience.  We do realize that our public spaces can get very busy, especially with the unique intermingling of our club members, hotel guests and other local patrons.  Most guests love the "buzz" of excitement in our lobby with our activation of the Renaissance Hotels "5 to 9" program and "business unusual" which creates a dynamic atmosphere to enjoy unique food and beverage.  That said, there are definitely more peaceful parts of the hotel property, as well as guestrooms which offer a more tranquil experience.  We hope to see you again soon and please do contact us in advance of your next stay - we're confident we can make some special arrangements in advance to ensure the best possible stay.  Thank you for choosing Renaissance Hotels.  Sincerely,  Michael Robby Director of Hotel Sales michael.robby@clubsports.com

Summary: Have been staying here on and off for the last several months and you can not find a nicer hotel, especially for business travel.  Nice rooms, great food, lively hotel bar scene, and the gym/health club is out of this world.  Truly everything you need when you are away from home.  Special recognition to Gabriela (Mgr) and her entire staff for providing such a comfortable and friendly atmosphere.  Will continue to come back again and again.

Summary Heading: A lot of activity at this hotel
Summary: The hotel was very modern, somewhat comfortable, with lots of activity at the in-house health club and in the lobby bar.  Self park across the street was convenient.  Rooms were decorated w/ modern flair.  Bed was very firm.  Staff was very friendly and attentive.  Price was ok. No club level or lounge at this hotel. Overall, not a bad stay..
Manager Response: Dear Smissy,  Thank you for choosing Renaissance Hotels, as we know you have many choices for your personal travels and we appreciate your preference.  Renaissance ClubSport Hotel, near Laguna Beach, offers our guests a resort-style hotel with modern technologies, a full-service Spa, and ClubSport, our state-of-the-art fitness experience. Our Renaissance is home to Citrus Grill and Lounge, which also offers a great, energetic environment to catch up with friends or colleagues.  We like to think we are a "hot spot" in this area of Orange County.  We hope to see you again soon, and let us know if there's anything we can do to make your next stay with us even better!  Sincerely,  Michael Robby Director of Hotel Sales michael.robby@clubsports.com

Summary Heading: Best boutique Hotel, Gym & Spa in The OC!
Summary: For the discerning local or Business professional. Renessance is the place to enjoy and plug into the community. This is where the elite top 1% work out great place to network, meet friends and share in activities.  They have a full bar, restaurant, pool & Spa+ more!  Offer discounts to members for guest to stay at their hotel. This property is under the Marriott brand hotels & Resorts.

This hotel is top notch.  It is always my first pick when I travel to Orange County. In addition to comfortable and well-kept rooms they have a great coffee bar with snacks and drinks.  Although all of the front desk staff, bellboys and parking attendants are very helpful, my very favorite is Abhi.  She is incredibly efficient and thorough and so warm and friendly.  I know we are in good hands when Abby is at the helm.

Summary Heading: Fablulous Stay at Renaissance Clubsport in Aliso Viejo
Summary: Just returned from a 3 day stay at Renaissance Clubsport in Aliso Veijo, California.  What an experience! Fantastic service from the first time we entered the hotel. We went there for a family wedding and rented close to 40 rooms . WOW.. Gabriela Williams and Abhi Sarkar at the front desk did a fabulous job in making every part of our stay exquisite. They became 'family' during our stay.  And did I mention the facility? 75,000 sq ft of workout area including everything imaginable from basketball courts, racquetball courts, 5 pools, lockers rooms with steam, sauna, and whirlpool, all type of weight training equipment,and machines, and a lap pool!! What a delight !  Rooms were clean and spacious. Suites also available.  And did I tell you about the day care? And the classes you

This was a really nice hotel.  The breakfast was not free, but it was excellent.  The staff was probably the nicest attentive ones we have ever had. Our room wasn't cleaned till 4:30 so that was a little inconvenient and the phone was super dusty so it made me wonder what else was missed, but it seemed clean besides that.  The hot tub was nice and we didn't use the gym.  It was a different hotel experience because of all the locals that use the place. It was a pricey hotel and the parking was $19.00 per night.

Stayed only one night, but was greeted by Abhi who was extremely attentive and made me feel special.  She was very pleasant and accommodating to my needs; gave me a restaurant coupon, which I used.  These hotel amenities are exceptional - wonderful atmosphere (boutique) and many options for exercising and relaxing. Will definitely stay here again!

This hidden gem is incredible. We were greeted by Abhi Sarkar and blown away by how friendly and efficient she was. With great staff, facilities, location, etc. I highly recommend you stay here.  Fantastic

Let me start by saying, I wish Marriott would expand this concept. If you enjoy working out on the road, this is the property for you! The gym is outstanding and you get to use all of it. I took 3 spin classes while there and my son had a 2 hour personal trainer session. We play basketball every day and while the weather wasn't great, used the pool and hot tub. There are plenty of good places to eat near by and Laguna Beach is only about 15 minutes away. The only 2 negative things I could say about the property is that the water pressure in the shower wasn't the best and that the hotel room was much more like a Courtyard room and not a renaissance type of room. Everyone we dealt with on the property was very friendly and helpful, I would stay here again when my travels take me

Summary Heading: Nice hotel - just didn't seem like a Marriott Category 7 property
Summary: While we had a very pleasant stay at the Renaissance and the staff was extremely helpful and kind, some things about our stay just didn't match our expectations for a top-tier Marriott property.    We were a little surprised that the TVs in the room were so small.  While I realize that people don't stay in this property to watch TV, it just seemed off.  Also, while traveling with family, it is nice to have a small fridge in the room.  We saw one sitting outside a room, so it looks like you can request this, but why would you have to request something that should be standard.    Loved the staff - they were great, and the bed was amazing.  Also loved the proximity to the beach - it is nice going to Laguna from the South.

We recently spent a night at the Renaissance Clubsport in Aliso Viejo. I had my two children with me, and was somewhat disappointed that I ended up with a king size bed instead of a double (my mistake when booking). The lady that I checked in with was extremely helpful and got us a rollaway bed. The room is so spacious that it was not at all on the way. The rooms are very clean and beautifully decorated. A big plus for me was how quiet the rooms were. During the entire time we were there, we did not hear anyone. We ended up getting room service in the morning, and the breakfast was delicious (go for the egg sandwich!).  The hotel does have a cafe, and it is a spa, so if you are interested in working out, it is the perfect place. Also, it has a great location. There are many

Summary Heading: A Gym with an attached hotel
Summary: The Renaissance Aliso Viejo is like a hotel built around a gym and spa. If you visit on a leisure trip, make sure you leave enough time to make use of the facilities, and also experiment some of the spa treatments. If you don't have much free time, at least try to use the nice swimming pool. The hotel itself is a typical mid-range Renaissance, with comfortable rooms, offering clean well maintained spaces, good linen and toiletries. Service is a bit more friendly than usual, possibly to the Sports Club setup. As a downside I would just say that the neighbourhood, whilst nice,  doesn't have a lot to offer, and when not enjoying the hotel facilities, you should be prepared to drive a bit and explore Southern California.

Summary Heading: Good standard of accommodation in the OC
Summary: Back in Aliso Viejo for business and spent four nights in the Renaissance ClubSport. The hotel is an interesting mix of hotel and health/leisure centre so attracts a pretty diverse crowd. Check-in was friendly and all the staff here seem friendly, so the atmosphere around the place is good. Our room was spacious and modern. We didn't use any of the gym facilities but they seem to be very popular, with a large number of non-hotel users always coming and going. Walking down to the town centre is easy from this hotel (not that many seemed to be walking in this area) and there are plenty of places to eat and shop there.  A good stay, nothing remarkable and you're probably not going to get the full value from staying here unless you partake of the leisure facilities on offer.

Summary Heading: Great hotel especially for those that love to workout!
Summary: We stayed for a little over one week and our experience was great. The workers are extremely helpful and welcoming once you enter the hotel. I thought the service was excellent especially from Abhi. She was nice and patient to answer any questions that I had and made my stay even better. The gym was my favorite part about the hotel. It had everything from basketball court to dance room to weight machines. I will definitely stay at this hotel again when I get the chance.

Summary Heading: Hotel has best Gym in OC
Summary: Can't get better than this!  Amazing it is in a hotel too. The equipment is top of the line, trainers superb, and operations staff on top of management at every turn.  I highly recommend this hotel, spa and gym.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for Laguna Beach Vacation
Summary: We stayed her for a week and LOVED this hotel.  Hubs and I planned our annual Laguna Beach vacation and decided to try a new hotel, away from the beach.  This was the perfect location for us. We had a rental car so it was easy to get to the beaches and activities.  There's plenty of dining, casual eats and shopping near the hotel too (I suggest Bruegger's Bagels for a quick breakfast and Baja Fish Tacos (delish!)).  The staff was friendly and helpful and someone was always at the front entrance to open the door for us.  The hotel is fresh and fun.  The rooms are clean, comfortable and spacious.  I didn't hear any noise from any other guest rooms.  The bathrooms are updated, large and the shower is spa like.  Free basic Wi-Fi, which is all we needed.  The bed is comfortable and

I only stayed there for 2 nights, but it was a nice and easy hotel.  The health club is big and amazing.  Next time I hope to spend more time there!  It was very convenient to the highways too, so easy to get to appointments in Delmar and Newport.

Stayed one night here while attending an event in Aliso Viejo.  Nice hotel, quite and comfortable rooms, friendly and efficient staff.  An full service gym attached, though we didn't actually make use of those facilities. It's a few miles east of Laguna Beach, but a quick drive if that's your destination.  Just up the hill from a large retail center with a good selection of restaurants and shops. Only negative was the $40 parking rate.  I'm OK with paying that much in LA for hotel parking, but seems a bit steep for the suburbs.
Manager Response: Dear JCruickshank,  Thank you for choosing Renaissance Hotels and we are glad you enjoyed our Renaissance ClubSport location here at Aliso Viejo / Laguna Beach.  Indeed, the lovely coastal town of Laguna is just minutes away, including great attractions like the Pageant of the Masters, Sawdust Art & Music Festival, etc.  We appreciate your review and hope to welcome you back soon.  Just to clarify, for the benefit of our future hotel guests, current parking rates are as follows:  Self-parking, $19.00 overnight Valet parking, $25.00 overnight  Here at Renaissance ClubSport Hotel we believe these rates to be very competitive in this part of Orange County.  Sincerely,  Michael Robby Director of Hotel Sales michael.robby@clubsports.com

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel several times and have generally been satisfied, but this time it was the pits.  I had reservations for 2-connecting rooms for 8 days during the holidays.  I needed accommodations for 4 boys and asked (in August) if they could put roll-away beds in a double and the connecting King.  I was assured they could and so I made reservations.  The week before checking in, I again asked about the roll-away beds and was again assured they could do that.  However, upon arrival I was told they could only put one roll-away bed in a king room and could not put one in the connecting double because it would violate their fire code.  Then end result is that I had to split the 4 boys up and only allow 2 or 3 to spend the night and had to make arrangements for the

We value your on-going partnership and loyalty to Marriott and Renaissance Hotels.  That said, we wish we could have done better for you and your family during this last hotel stay.  Sometimes, even at up-scale, full-service hotels, our facilities due have some limitations.  Our Renaissance Ambassadors are trained to offer solutions to our guests, while protecting guest safety at all times.  Nevertheless, please allow us the opportunity to serve you better on a future visit.  It's my sincere pleasure to offer personal assistance in advance of your next stay, so we may really exceed your expectations.  Kind regards,  Michael Robby Director of Hotel Sales Renaissance ClubSport Hotel michael.robby@clubsports.com

Summary: Upon arrival at this property, we got warm reception from Sam.  He's so nice and professional, gave us clear direction of what we should do and where we should go to use the sports facility.  We had an incident that the rollaway bed collapsed 3am in the morning which kept all of us up the rest of the night.  When I told the management about the strange incident, Agnus immediately showed her concern and really cared about what we went through, and called the house keeping to exam the bed for safety.  The fine customer service is what made this property standout from the rest.  Thank you Sam, Agnus, and Steven(waiter at breakfast).

Stayed in December 2016 on business. Entryway is nice. Front desk staffed by very friendly person. Room was functional and quiet. High speed internet worked very well. Breakfast was nice - I appreciate the selection and omelet station. The breakfast staff are very courteous. 2 twin beds are a bit small for me - but that's not a knock against the hotel. Convenient location to highway. Lots of options for dining nearby.

Summary Heading: Nice, upscale with great pool and gym
Summary: We got 2 rooms for one night. One had 1 king bed and chaise lounge. Had coffee and tea in the room. Bathrooms are amazing! Spa-like. The other had 2 double beds. Clean and spacious. I like the lobby. There's valet and parking structure. I would have given it a 5 star but there was no breakfast included. Tedious to go out to get breakfast and expensive to order room service. Also, the housekeeping started knocking on doors at 8AM which was just really annoying. They should have a list of people who have checked out or at least not start knocking that early.

Summary Heading: Dont bother if you aren't a regular!
Summary: Marriott platinum but that isn't important here?  What's important is that you are a townie.  Otherwise good luck getting service. Check in was good.  She was very nice but downhill from there.  Had dinner and sat in a corner booth to work on some paperwork out of the way.  You would have thought I was taking up a booth at the hottest restaurant in town playing pick up sticks with my butt cheeks! I was getting a bit of work done before the holidays.  there were plenty of open tables but no one seemed to want to wait on mine!  Never mind! I will stay somewhere else next time that appreciates a 100 night per year traveler!
Manager Response: Dear cece1322,  Greetings from the Management of the Renaissance ClubSport Hotel here at the Aliso Viejo / Laguna location.  We appreciate your honest review and thank you for bringing this to our attention so we may follow up with our restaurant team at the Citrus Fresh Grill.  Though we continually strive for excellence, we do sometimes falter, and as it appears we could have done much better for you during your recent stay, we would propose to invite you back for a VIP table and upgraded hotel experience.  It's the least we can do and hope to turn this around for you and showcase the Renaissance ClubSport Hotel and our Citrus Fresh Grill in the true manner of classy upscale service as is our mission.  Sincerely,  Marco Rongen Director of Operations marco.rongen@clubsports.com

Summary: I've had a handful of meetings here throughout the years with overnight stays for meeting attendees, and the staff, especially Haley Jaramillo, has been super helpful, courtesy, kind, and professional.  Every event starts with a point person and Haley was my point person. She knew her stuff and made it so much easier for me to plan world-class meetings. She is extremely experienced and knowledgeable with meeting planning and ensuring a smooth event from start to finish. Based on our previous experience with Haley, we decided to host our company holiday party at the hotel, and the planning for it as been easy on my part. Haley has done all the heavy lifting, planning, and suggestions, so that I don't have to worry about it. Thank you!!!!  And their gym and pool is spectacular!
Manager Response: Dear Alex,  We sincerely appreciate your continued partnership with the Renaissance ClubSport Hotel - and so glad to know Haley and team are taking great care of you.  Wishing you and your team a very happy holidays!  Kind regards,  Michael Robby Director of Hotel Sales michael.robby@clubsports.com

Summary Heading: Not the greatest for my wedding weekend
Summary: When I was standing in line for check-in, the front desk told the couple in front of me that since they are celebrating their anniversary, they will waive their parking fee. Naturally, my husband and I thought we would get the same perk, as we were staying in the large Sweet Room, getting married that weekend, and also had a room block there for all of our guests. However, even when we explained this, the front desk did not offer anything. So disappointed. We went to the front desk a little later in the day, and a different person hesitantly waived our parking fee, making sure that we knew that none of our guests in our blocks would get the same service. That wasn't our expectation at all and we didn't ask for free parking for all of our guests so we were surprised at her bitter
Manager Response: Dear Mari I,  Greetings from the Renaissance ClubSport Hotel - Aliso Viejo/Laguna Beach. Summary: My wife and I spent 4 nights while visiting our daughter nearby. The hotel is simple and elegant, without being too snooty. The staff are fantastic, from the valet, front desk, bar, restaurant or fitness center. There is a Starbucks in the lobby that also serves healthy shakes and smoothies. The fitness center is as nice as it gets. We enjoyed the lap pool, hot tub and fitness center, all complimentary as a hotel guest. My wife enjoyed yoga classes with different instructors teaching different styles. The health club is busy. Mornings are particularly busy because area residents are members of the fitness center and come before work for their workout. We will stay here anytime we return to the Aliso Viejo/Laguna Beach area. For a great selection of dining options visit the city

This hotel was exceptional all around. You get the professionalism and friendly service of a hotel and in addition, you have 75000 sqf of fitness facility at your service. From the Valet staff who were all fantastic to the front desk agent, Samson who was extremely professional all the way to the outstanding housekeeping crew who seemed like they were cleaning the place 24 hours of the day. The restaurant on site is remarkable with a very chill and relaxed patio sitting by the pool, healthy and wholesome menu items, delicious drinks, and Skylar, our server, provided excellent service for us. All of the rooms seemed newly remodeled with super comfortable bed and anything we needed was provided for us as quickly as possible. I would definitely return in the future.

Summary Heading: Great hotel and fantastic health club
Summary: My wife and I stayed last weekend and loved the facilities and the service.  Would highly recommend for both business and pleasure.  Our room was a great size and the Terri was very soft.  Two robes in the room were very convenient.  We didn't eat in the restaurant but hung out on the terrace after dinner where there were very nice fire pits.

This is a very good hotel attached to a fantastic fitness center.  The hotel is typical Renaissance, which is to say a nice facility with excellent service.  The fitness center is amazing, with court sports, two pools, many classes such as zumba, yoga, and spinning, and a huge weight and cardio room.  The bar is decent, but gets very crowded on the weekends.  The breakfast buffet is excellent.  There is a parking structure across the street that hotel guests can use for free, or valet parking if you prefer.  I would have given it five bubbles except for one problem.  They had live music outside by the pool Friday night, and we had gone to bed early to catch a very early morning flight.  The music was loud, making it difficult to sleep, even way up on the sixth floor.  I can only

Because of my extended stay, I was actually see the quality of service and amenities this hotel provides. Their staff is an excellent one, always willing to go extra mile in helping you. Although their dining menu is okay, their services are good. I felt like a second home. Denise in particular was very good person making me to feel like a home. She is very attentive and would custom make meals for someone like me - vegetarian

Summary Heading: Absolutely Incredible!!  Above and beyond the call of duty at every opportunity!!
Summary: A native of Manhattan, I have been coming to this beautiful property on business multiple times a year for just over 6 years.  It is my favorite hotel, period.  This is inclusive of Four Seasons, InterContinental and other luxury properties across the world.  The rooms, the gym, the restaurant, the outdoor seating with fire pits, are exceptional and inviting.  Recently, our company hosted a larger meeting at a luxury hotel on the water not far from the Renaissance ClubSport Aliso.  My colleagues and I were so disappointed -not in the place we stayed, but that it wasn't the Renaissance.  Each time I stay here I am welcomed by a team that knows me.  Smiles abound.  This morning, I notified them that I needed to extend my stay an additional night.  Unfortunately, the Renaissance

We've stayed in many hotels. This one is definitely my favorite. From the young men who valet, front desk friendliness, waiters, waitresses ( morning & evening), delicious food and very polite housekeeping ladies. Beautiful grounds and very clean. LOVE IT!

Summary Heading: This one covers too many options, but they do it well!
Summary: We were back in town for several reasons and chose this location for its more central location to the stuff that we needed to do as the options are plentiful in Orange County.    The entrance to the hotel by car is a little underwhelming immediately off the main road, but the valet / drop off area is plenty big to accommodate the typical rush that they might receive.  Parking / Valet is extra and pricey, but it allows them to publish a lower price and I assume that they are making some money off the deal with the garage across the way.    Check in was great and clean (we used the Marriott app and had our check in scheduled which always makes things easier).  Straight to our room with everything that was requested!  That is unfortunately rare these days.  The room was clean and

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay- great experience!!
Summary: We were looking for a place to stay near Laguna Beach and Newport Coast and found the Renaissance ClubSport....as far as location goes, it is in a nice area right off Hwy 73, but a good 15-20 minute ride to either Laguna Beach or Dana Point....are room was very nice, clean and comfortable and big- would have liked to have a mini fridge? The sports facilities here are amazing and free to hotel guests- with 3 pools, including a large lap pool, large gym and plenty for the exercise conscious!! The restaurant also had a really good breakfast buffet complete with omelet station, pancakes, waffles and french toast, their own homemade granola and excellent hot oatmeal! Service there was also incredible! As a matter of fact everyone at this hotel was there to hold the door and ask how

Summary Heading: Nice - "Trendy" - Good place to work up a sweat
Summary: Interesting place...basically a super fitness club with a nice hotel attached. Summary Heading: Great Hotel for Laguna Beach Vacation
Summary: I stumbled upon the Renaissance ClubSport hotel when planning my trip to Laguna Beach.  Mainly, I was interested in a clean, comfortable hotel that was within driving distance to Laguna Beach/area attractions and wouldn't break the bank.  Overall, this hotel delivered!!!  As many guests mentioned, access to the beautiful fitness center is included in your stay.  Unfortunately, I did not utilize any of the amenities as I spent most of my time site seeing and beach hopping.  The hotel was about a 15 minute drive to Laugna Beach and is located outside the hustle and bustle of downtown.  This was a feature I really liked!!  While I did feel like the hotel was "out in no man's land,"  I was quickly surprised how close it was to local conveniences like CVS, supermarkets, etc.    The

Summary Heading: All about the gym and the pool
Summary: Super super location. If you want a world class gym and a super pool complex with quality hotel accommodation, stay here. Really very good. Ridiculous $19 per day for parking but could not find any alternatives nearby so just factor it in. World class basketball court for practice. Top tip for breakfast: put Brueggers Bagels into your SatNav for breakfast. The "Western" is truly amazing. SatNav does not take you the quickest route - it is only a mile away. Definitely try it. Nice location for breakfast. Great hotel location to stay. Ok, the fitness club staff are a bit precious, but the hotel staff are super charming (young lady who "batted" my questions with aplomb). Stay! It is well worth it. Tommy Bahamma's in Laguna Beach was great for dinner.

Summary Heading: Odd Location, Odd Feel but we still had a good time!
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of our California Vacation. We felt that the whole place felt a bit odd, we never felt like hotel guests more a Fitness centre with rooms attached.   The atrium is always extremely noisy. Everything is in one place, Hotel Reception, cafe, restaurant, shop and Fitness Centre reception which means it's always busy. The fitness facilities at this location are outstanding, but again this is what makes it feel a bit strange. As a guest you really do feel when using the facilities that you are almost encroaching on the locals who obviously pay a huge amount for membership of such a comprehensive facility. We joined a couple of spin classes and our girls did some early morning swim training (even though we were on vacation!). The instruction

The staff was amazing and was always willing to help. The Valet service was top notch and recognized me as soon as I went outside and often got the car without asking. Great lounge and spa the messages are awesome. Pool was nice but crowded. Looking forward to going back.

Clean, comfortable, and cozy setting. Poolside breakfast is superb. Great service and best hotel gym ever. Only downside: Make sure you get parking included as this could be quiet expensive. I got a free parking and breakfast package. It was worth the extra 10$ per night. It is a combo of an "a la carte" and breakfast buffet. Food was delicious and service was first class. I will stay here again.

Never stayed there. Found it quick online and was more than please. For the bachelor party scene, there were a lot of families and children which I totally get. Loved the gym/club portion. Would go there as a regular if I was closer in demographic. Would stay again.

Summary Heading: Excellent and comfortable Hotel but as a bonus you get an amazing workout facility!!
Summary: After traveling all week looking at colleges with our son, we pulled into the Renaissance ClubSport for a night and were delighted to get access to their fantastic athletic facility. I was able to take a PiYo class in the evening and in the morning got up early to use the machines and weights before we went to yet another college tour. In addition, a breakfast buffet is offered. Reasonably priced and some nice bonuses.

Summary Heading: Surprisingly lovely hotel and sports club
Summary: My husband booked this hotel for a night away for my birthday. We were very amazed at how much we enjoyed it and how well we were treated. When Jason at the front desk  found out it was my birthday, he gave me a choice of what I would like delivered to our room as a birthday treat when we arrived back from dinner. He gave us suggestions of where to go for dinner and was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our room and were surprised at the sports facilities available. The facilities and locker rooms are bigger than our gym we belong to at home. Very big, bright, and well equipped. We enjoyed one of the pools the next day. Our stay was most enjoyable and we would recommend it. The only downside was the $19 for parking.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for work or play
Summary: The locations is perfect, the workout facilities are superior to any hotel I've ever stayed at. Amazing views from all of the rooms I've been in (I've stayed here 3 times).  On my 3rd stay, I upgraded to one of the executive suites, and it was amazing. Great room layout, décor, and the Jacuzzi tub is awesome!   Very well maintained property, inside and out.

This is a great place to stay it has 3 nice pools very quiet area it has a large gym and a indoor basket ball court. we were there for one night. breakfast was very good a bit pricey. parking was 25 dollars for valet 19 for self park.room very nice and clean bed very conferrable great pillows. staff very nice and can answer any questions that you have about the area.will return some day but spend more time there.

Summary Heading: This hotel is NOT in Laguna Beach
Summary: If you are not familiar with the area (which we were not) before booking this hotel it is important to note that although it is called "Laguna Beach Hotel" it is not in Laguna Beach.  It is about a 20 minute ride down the hillside to reach the restaurants and galleries of Laguna Beach.  The hotel is very nice and would have been perfect if it were located where the name of the hotel seems to suggest.  The area is picturesque and the hotel is trendy with a full service gym located onsite that guests are free to use.  If that is what you want then this hotel will be great for you.  If you are like us and want to be in Laguna Beach, you should look at one of the smaller hotels in the area.  I feel that the name of the hotel is misleading and they are intentionally attempting

Workout facilities are world class -- the hotel sells memberships to their workout club but free to guests.  Several large pools.  Room was large and very quiet.

This was a very good hotel.  All of the staff were friendly and helpful.. The room was very modern and well appointed.  Sharing the space with a "health club" was unique.  I started here on a business trip as were most of the people I met.  If looking for a resort style hotel in Orange County I suggest getting closer to the beach but if staying for business this is a good choice.

Nice food everywhere-even around the pool and it's not expensive.   I had a delicious salad with vegetables for $8.00 poolside.    Great Starbucks in the lobby for quick eats in the morning or  the casual restaurant overlooking the pool and grounds.    Great air conditioning and wonderful beds. Your staff is well trained, for sure, to be super polite.

Summary: This hotel and fitness facility are a healthy persons dream!!! I can't wait to go back.  Hotel first: the rooms are very spacious with upgraded decor and huge walk in showers. Restaurant is open all day so anytime you need to eat it's all available to you. The menu has "trainer approved" meal options which means they are balanced with the right amount of nutrients and calories. So you can eat a great meal and not feel guilty.  There's a huge patio so you can sit inside or outside when you dine.  Restaurant staff is super friendly and accommodating.  Gym: it's massive!!!!!! 5 group fitness rooms with plenty of classes.  Huge amount of weights and cardio equipment plus an outdoor lap pool. It's so clean and well maintained. And it's included for free in the cost of the room!!!

If I could order up my dream hotel this would be it!  I'll get to the hotel in a moment but the sports club you have access to is excellent, has great classes, a proper swimming pool and is open long hours.  The club alone is worth staying here.  If you try to stay fit when on the road, look no further.  Stay here.  You'll love it.  The hotel is very nice.  Comfy beds, great food at reasonable prices, excellent/helpful staff and a self park option.  The prices are the prices no surprises like other properties in the area.  It is by far the best option in South OC and I'll be missing it when I travel next -  wishing I were staying here rather than at whatever hotel is available in the area I'm visiting for work.  I can't wait to return.  Thanks guys!

Summary Heading: Great spot for work or play
Summary: Really love this location.  I stay here for work and the hotel and staff are great.  Excellent outdoor patio for drinks and food. Always enjoy my stay great area to jog/walk.  Don't miss the excellent gym on site where you see people coming to work out from all over the area.

Had a great spa weekend with my friend at the Renaissance ClubSport.  The hotel is definitely geared towards an active, health minded customer.  The gym was huge, there were multiple classes offered  and there is a separate pool for swimming laps. Our room was comfortable, although we could easily hear a lot of noise from the room next door, which was actually adjoining.    My friend mentioned at check-in that we were celebrating my birthday, and the lady who checked us in was very sweet to arrange for a comp on my dessert ordered through room service.  That was a really nice touch.  Room service was good, except there was one small problem the next morning.  I had ordered the breakfast croissant sandwich, but when it arrived, they had just used plain bread - no croissant.  We

My husband and i decided to try someplace different when we visit my mother in law. We were immediately greeted by 2 bellman as we drive in. They asked whether to valet or not  which we did.
