Summary Heading: Great concept for the active traveler
Summary: The Renaissance Clubsport is a unique type of hotel in that it is quite literally half upscale gym and half hotel. This was my first time staying in this part of Orange County and was attacked to this property due to the fact that it offered a large, nice gym (I'm talking much nicer than your typical LA Fitness type chain) and nice outdoor areas. This hotel is unique in that it has a large upscale gym with basketball court, squash courts, racquetball, a huge workout room, countless machines, a full service spa, outdoor pools, and fitness classes. In addition, the locker rooms have nice steam rooms, spas, and saunas, towel service, etc. for no change to guests.   Bright colors and shades of blues make the guest rooms and public areas very nice and relaxing. Customer service was

The hotel as a excellent Gym and is perfect for everyone that wants to be in shape. The only downside that I found was that some rooms are too noisy due to the proximity of the AC machines in the outside. The staff is friendly

We have two young children. This hotel was kid friendly with the café downstairs it was easy to grab milk and breakfast items. There is a splash area and kiddie pool that was wonderful to let the kids play in. Staff was very accommodating. I will say this is a hot spot, very busy with lots of people coming to the fitness center or the restaurant. But it's a great spot if you want to stay in this area. Easy access to shopping and freeway.

Summary Heading: Great hotel if you want to work out
Summary: Enjoyed my stay. This is a newer hotel. Everything was modern and clean.  Service with a smile at every turn. The gym, which is attached to this hotel is phenomenal. Also has a Large pool for swimming laps.  Had a good dinner and drinks at the bar. Nice outdoor seating with fire pits. Highly recommend this hotel for South OC visits.

Summary Heading: Perfect place for the fitness oriented traveler
Summary: As many of the previous reviews have alluded to this is an awesome place if fitness on the road is a priority.  Having a12,000 square foot state of the art gym connected to the hotel is awesome.  The rooms are perfectly acceptable as well, with comfortable beds and quality furnishings.    Some of the other reviews questioned the service level, but I found everyone very friendly and accommodating.  The restaurant has very good and very health food which was a plus. If you are Platinum Elite (or I think gold) you get the complimentary breakfast buffet which includes cooked to order omelets and an array of hot and cold dishes.  There is no Concierge Lounge at this hotel.  One thing that other reviews don't mention is because a lot of travelers stay here for the fitness aspect, it

This property has it all. A great hotel, spa and restaurant. Aside from that they have a place called Kids World that you can leave the kids and have some couple time whether it s working out or enjoying an amazing meal. The classes are challenging and the employees are top notch. I live in Aliso Viejo and actually have a membership here and it is worth every penny.

The hotel itself is fine, points for the workout facility which is nice. The rooms are nothing special. Being Marriott platinum we were offered an 'upgrade' to a King bed.   The hotel is siloed in a business park kind of area. There's nothing much around it Aliso Viejo although some shops are restaurants are within a few miles drive.  A plus, and it's huge, is their excellent breakfast buffet.

Summary: My friend and I stayed here for my 50th birthday for some fun and relaxation and we were able to get it! The overall service of the hotel was terrific. The theme of the hotel is fitness, with the very large state of the art facility (with kids club) - - the rooms have dumbbells and pictures of fitness equipment so that's kind of funny. Summary: Another opportunity to stay at the Renaissance for the holidays using the special provided to my sister and her family, as members of the Club Sport.  Great deal with lower room rates, free parking, use of the entire Club Sport, and complimentary breakfast brunch.  Good sized rooms. Great food and drinks.  Service at Citrus was excellent, especially Carlos.  Enjoyed the pool and outdoor hot tub, when it was returned to service after wind knocked out the filter.

I have stayed at the Aliso Viejo property a couple of times and each time has been consistently good. From the door greeting , to the check-in (I was offered water while waiting for a few minutes), to the rooms which are spacious and very comfortable.  Dining option of Citrus and the take-out cafe is great and healthy. Plus, I can use the beautiful sports facility located in the same building for free. I am planning on another stay over Thanksgiving - just a little r&r from LA.

Summary Heading: Great Place For Fitness Minded Travellers
Summary: This is my second stay here and I simply love the huge fitness facility and proximity to the Laguna Beach.  Very affordable and get full use of fitness and lap pool along with the spa like men locker room.

Summary Heading: Excellent place for work and work out
Summary: This is a great place for health freaks. The Gym is fabulous and the pool just too good. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The hotel provides extra amenities in the room on request. The only area of improvement is the restaurant. The food is repetitive,  average and boring.

Summary Heading: Top of the line with reasonable rates and amenities
Summary: What a gem hidden in Aliso Viejo Calif.!!!  Close to so many areas and the ocean too.  Rooms are very reasonable for the area and well appointed.  It's such a comfortable, welcoming from the moment you entered the hotel.  It's kids friendly.  Don't know about pets?  There is a great bar, restaurant, smoothie bar/snacks, 2 Olympic pools, fabulous outside patio with sofas, addl seating, bar and live band on weekends for listening and dancing.  Just a nice vibe for all ages.  The entire outside area is great for families too.  There is a spa (extra cost) and fitness center (free) which can be used as a hotel guest. Summary: One of the best "membership" sports club but as a hotel resident you get a day pass to all the sports / fitness and outdoor facilities so take full advantage! Hotel itself is good (not great) but the addition of sports facilities makes it special...

This property is split in two halves, a fully equipped large and modern gym, and the hotel. Summary Heading: The employees comes in room unannounced twice.  Also, happened to the person next door to us.
Summary: The hotel is very clean and very trendy.  The bed is comfortable, and I slept very well.  I had a view of the pool.  Parking is extra $15, I don't know why, it's not in the middle of the city like NYC, or South Beach where every square inch is packed. Laguna beach is about 10 mins by car, so don't miss out on that.  The swimming pool is full of people, we could not find any chairs. It turned out locals can enjoy their facility for a cost.  When we were eating dinner a housekeeping male employee entered our room, and saw we were in there and apologized but didn't even explain who he was. The next morning, another employee nearly entered our room again.  Also, when we were on our way out a female housekeeping employee entered the room the next door unannounced as well. BUT WHY???

Summary Heading: Amazing Gym, Locker Room, and Pool!
Summary: What a Weekend! Olympic-sized pool with 6 swim lanes, the giant hot tub in the ladies locker room, healthy snack bar, 70,000 square foot gym, and only minutes away from the Laguna shops, restaurants, and art festivals, make this a must-do romantic and fun weekend for my husband and I every summer.  We started coming here from the first season they opened, and it only gets better and better.  They will let you come in early to use the facilities before check-in time, and we always have a full-morning workout before a late check-out.  Great staff! Big fun!

I felt like a misfit in this place crowded by fitness freaks! Being closer to work, I chose this closer to town Centre place for a comparatively longer stay of three weeks! The crowded gym is good for members and resident feel out of place! The squash court in site is a good variation.

Sporty Atmosphere (half hotel,half Fitness center),nice rooms, nice stuff. Lots to do around, 15 min to Laguna Beach, easy drive. Parking was extra (15 $), but the price was still good. Dont miss the beaches of Laguna and some whale watching in Danas Point.

the properties is just perfect! nice clean and spacious rooms beautiful fitness center complimentary for the hotel guests super useful front desk great location - only 7 km away from the Laguna Beach area

We stayed here one night while we stopped on our way to San Diego. The hotel was very clean the customer service great and the gym was just amazing. Keep in mind that this hotel is a sport club as well so the gym is just huge, it has everything you would possibly need , 3 pools , dry sauna, steam room, 2 hot tubs, basketball court , spa and so on..

This was one of the best hotel stays I have had at the Marriott right from the start the staff was awesome.  the room was very nice the pool area is very nice they also have a 75 thousand square foot gym.  it is a healthy atmosphere the buffet in the morning is very good.  this hotel exceeded all of my expectations

The bedrooms follow a standard pattern but the bed is good and there's lots of work area. Coffee and water are provided in the room. The free Wi-Fi is excellent and capable of supporting Skype calls. The only thing I didn't like was the lack of a walk in shower. Showers in baths are OK but a walk in would be so much nicer!

The reservation have not been confirmed by the time we got to the Renaissance. Of course on a Friday night it is almost impossible to get a room on a holiday weekend especially at the last minute. Summary: When we first pulled up to this hotel at around 9:30 that night, we could tell it was a very popular, upscale property. When I then walked in the hotel to check in, that's when I knew it would be extra special.  Standing near the full service bar was a gentleman who, if I can be a little bit politically incorrect, was a white Flava Flav.  He had a gold tooth or two, hey Shay me polyester tracksuit, and yes - a great big clock on a chain around his neck. It was then that I noticed a pilot in his flight suit that looked remarkably like Tom Cruise from Top Gun. Them there were others from Twisted Sister, the Go-Go's, and much, much more.   Once checked in, we went to our room and open the window to hear the DJ playing  music down by the pool while scores of people danced nearby.

Just spent 3 nights at this resort.  When we booked we were very excited to see a fitness resort option for our trip.  Our family of 6 is very fitness/health oriented.  This facility definitely showcases the healthy and wealthy people! The hotel is nice, the room are an average American size room.  We did have to change one of the rooms after the first night because our A/C was not working.  This was an inconvenience, but we managed it. The reason I give it a 3 star is because of the staff at the fitness facility.  They were a bit condescending and unfriendly to the hotel guests and I noticed they treated the "member" much differently.  Our family was enjoying an afternoon at the pool when my 13 yr old needed to use the restroom.  Within 1 minute he was being scolded at by staff

Summary: The Renaissance ClubSport caters to the active, exercise minded and youthful segment.  This is not to say it is not a wonderful place to stay if you do not fit into that mold.  The rooms are spacious and well appointed.  The staff is very helpful and efficient.  The check in process was as easy as it gets for a hotel of this size.  Valet parking is a bottleneck during busy times (early morning and late afternoon) but overall is also very efficient.  The room service menu is varied, healthy and appetizing.  The ammenities are top notch.

Traveling with a couple of fitness fanatics so this place had it all for them.  I'm not so much a fitness freak, but they raved so much about the facility, I had to give it a try. It was pretty nice. Has everything you can think of. My family would come back just for this.   I also enjoyed the pool and hot tub and sitting out by the fire pit for a glass of wine. Rooms were nice, bathrooms spa like. There actually is a spa there, but I didn't have time to enjoy it.  The hotel carries its fitness theme throughout the entire resort. The valets and housekeeping staff wear sporty athletic type clothing. The specialty drinks offered are healthy sounding. There's a juice bar and pictures on the walls in the rooms are of different sport activities.   We don't have young children, but

Same complaint as other reviewer that described early AM fire alarms. We can for four nights over memorial day weekend. On Saturday AM, the fire alarms went off for almost two hours starting at 5AM about every 20 minutes. We were already tired, and that didn't help.   What was really unacceptable is that I called to complain, was hung up on by the front desk female clerk, and no compensation was made to our bill. I had to directly confront the staff regarding the failure of the hotel to rectify the problem. We got a little money back, but should not have had to ask.   Also,  NO CONCIERGE LOUNGE!  BEWARE!

On the phone we were told that check in was 4:00, I asked if earlier was possible and she said that she'd put in the request. We arrived at 3:30 and the front desk agent said that it would be about 20-25 minutes. 4:00 I checked in again, sorry, another 20 minutes, I was told. Finally, at 4:30 we got our room. Nice, good size, clean, really great view! Ripped sheets were not so good, but otherwise, we loved the room!  The kids club looks ok. Sort of dark and cave like and my son was way too mature to be in the tiny room with all of the crying 2 year old... He's 2 months shy of 2.5, but they would not allow him in the area for 2.5 year old, I understand

We only stayed one night while visiting a family member in the city. We had a 12 year old and a 14 year old with us. I wouldn't suggest this place for that age because they wanted an adult to be with them everywhere they went. Even for basketball and racketball. However, for adults the outdoor lounge and pool area were super nice. The food was also incredible. The location is kind of in the industrial part of town so not great. I would go here with girlfriends for sure for a spa weekend.

I loved this hotel. For the short time that I stayed here, it was fabulous. We did not have to pay for any self-parking and the location of the hotel is very close to shopping areas and places to eat. On our first night we checked in late, and it wasn’t a big deal. Then the male staff member we worked with decided to upgrade my boyfriend and I to a "sweet" room. We are both still baffled to why he decided to upgrade us, but it was AWESOME! The room was huge. This room had a small sitting area with a couch, TV, office area, closet, and a small sink with coffee/tea maker. Then behind the dividing wall was our king size bed with another TV and closet. Convenient coffee bar for quick breakfast. Beautiful pool and workout area. Super Comfy beds and well thought out rooms.   The second night the fire alarm went off. 5:15 am. We re talking buzzer and strobe lights in the room. People going into the hall. Grabbing a robe and your cell phone. False alarm. Ok. Back to sleep. Then the alarm goes off again. And again. And again. And again. By 6:15 am I tried to get to the front desk. The elevators were not functioning.  Went down six flights of stairs.  The doors were locked. Up. Down. Good workout. Kudos to the crew at the front desk. They were apologetic and understanding. A comp

Very nice rooms and convenient location. Highly recommend if you need to be in this area. Easy drive to restaurants in Laguna Beach. I didn't use the fitness/ pool facilities but they look excellent.   It is on the pricey side so location convenience is an I mportant consideration.

Summary Heading: Great hotel with great health club thrown in
Summary: Just visited for second time, and this place continues to impress.  Lobby area and restaurant are bright, modern, and attract a young, vibrant crowd, many of whom are probably there because of the health club.  Spacious rooms that are well maintained.  Nice buffet breakfast, although not sure I'd pay the full $17 rate for it - try to get a rate that includes it.  (If not, consider Bagels and Brew for breakfast in the nearby shopping center.)  Best thing about the hotel is the health club.  Huge facility with lots of equipment, indoor basketball court, studios for classes, great locker room facilities, and a wonderful pool complex outside with a large pool and 2 smaller kids' pools.  Definitely gives this hotel a resort feeling.  Hotel is located inland from Laguna Beach about 20

I stayed at the Renaissance ClubSport due to its proximity to Dana Point, as I had meetings there.  At first I was a bit disappointed that I couldn't find a place closer, but in the end I came away very pleased.  I have actually done the same trip again and chosen to stay here as my first choice.  Clean, well appointed rooms.  Great facilities, with dining, fitness, and outdoor activities.  As I don't have a lot of time when traveling for business, it was great having top notch facilities under one roof.  Very accommodating staff as well.  Good value, and a couple of great stays.

Summary Heading: Great fitness club, pools, and very fast WIFI
Summary: Pro: This hotel is an interesting concept being connected to a community fitness club.  You definitely want to take advantage of the club if you stay here.  All classes are free and babysitting is $5/hr/child, with 3 hours per day limit.  There is a 25 yard lap pool, a smaller pool, a kiddie pool and a play area with slides and water features.  The water is cold at the water feature pool, but the kids didn’t seem to mind since there is a kids hot tub next to it.  The staff is polite and accommodating.  CJ at the front desk was especially polite, spending time on the phone with me pre-arrival to discuss our stay.    The breakfast buffet for elite members is nice with plenty of choices and a made to order omelet station.  The small room can feel very crowded, but you can choose to

The hotel itself is located in the hills of Aliso Viejo and the vista is stunning.  The lobby of the hotel is absolutely gorgeous.  There is a bar, a restaurant, and a coffee shop.  There is an outside deck area, complete with gas fire pits that makes having a drink in the cool California night very enjoyable.  The staff was very helpful all the way around.  The bar staff had some great recommendations, were very playful as far as their selections - wonderful sense of humor all the way around.  The other hotel staff were also extremely helpful as far as local recommendations and taking care of any issues that occur.  The hotel room

Love the relax healthy dynamic of the hotel, great place for work, play or just have a relax weekend, the rooms are clean with a lot of light, green, blue, and yellow colors all around, everyone is helpful and friendly, close to Laguna Beach and town center. The gym is excellent, pools are great to do some laps or get some sun and beer!  The concept of clubsport hotel is well deliver, we had a great weekend, food was good, stuff was great.

Very nice place. Everyone is helpful and friendly. Staff made me feel welcome and comfortable. A lot of people in and out to use the fitness center.  Seems to be the big draw and place to meet and workout.    Tried the restaurant... had the steak which was good. A great place to gather with a lot of activity.   Hotel and rooms are clean. Good ambiance and contemporary decor throughout,  but the rooms seemed dated and worn (example curtains,  furniture,  and of all things the room phones).  While I may see this in some hotels that are hanging on from a past reputation, I did not expect it from this hotel.  However, all in all a good experience and I would recommend staying at least once to try it out.

I would rate it 5 however the first night the room next to us had drunk idiots arguing, yeling, cursing, hitting the wall (which was where our bed was) @ 2am. I called the front desk and they came up and handled it. But then sure enough 5 minutes later they began the same thing again yelling and cursing so I called a 2nd time. They were relatively quiet after that. The hotel did comp us the first night. Of course we asked to move rooms as we were there another 2nights. Unfortunately they didn't have another room with 2 beds. The rest of our stay was awesome. They have a splash pad and 1.5 ft pool that the kids loved. The food there is good too. We would definitely come back again. Great service.

Summary Heading: Great place for work or play
Summary: i work nearby and this is always the place I stay.  Very resorty, great food and rooms and excellent gym.  Close to many things to do.  15 min from SNA and 20 min from Laguna Beach.  Nice fire pits outside for cocktails at end of day.

Summary: We had always wanted to visit Laguna Beach and decided to finally do so. After scouring on the web for a place to stay, we found the Renaissance. We were beyond pleasantly surprised to find that this place looked brand new and was very modern. The service (especially the guys who open the door for you each time you enter/exit the building and Ann, who checked us in) was exceptional. It was within 5 minutes of a ton of restaurants, movie theater, and shops for convenience. We will definitely return and so should you!

I've always wanted to visit Laguna Beach, and my husband decided to make that dream a reality for our last anniversary. However, we didn't have a sitter for our trip, so we had to bring our 6 yr old son. This property was PERFECT!!!! The "Kid's Club" was filled with activities that kept him occupied while we had time alone. And the pool & the bar near the pool was amazing. The staff even surprised us with complimentary champagne to help us celebrate! The room was perfect for the three of us! My son continuously asks if we can go back to the "Hotel & Kid's Club." I would recommend this place to the active couple or small family! And the drive to the beach wasn't too far either! Love Love LOVE this place!!!!

Honestly, I loved this place. The contemporary decor, cleanliness, the overall health vibe - it rocks. The restaurant staff was hit-and-miss as far as service, but the rooms were great. The fitness rooms were well maintained too.

I've stayed at this property a number of times; it's within a block of my company's corporate headquarters. I was staying pretty much monthly for several months, but hadn't been there between August 2014 and January 2015. But when I walked in, the front desk agent greeted me by name. That's the sort of thing that really sets a property apart in my book.  This hotel has an extensive, high end gym off its lobby, to which many locals belong. My schedule hasn't allowed me to even visit it; it has a great reputation, but I can't speak to it personally.  I can say the rooms are quite nice and very large. Many have a nice view of the Saddleback Valley and Santa Ana Mountains. I've never had an issue with cleanliness or not having enough towels, etc. Very comfortable (as is typical of

Summary Heading: Chestnut of a Place to Stay for Our Family
Summary: This has become a wonderful tradition to spend holidays with family at the Renaissance.  Family members live not far away and are members of the Club so a great opportunity to check in at a better than usual price with breakfast buffet included.  All of us use the pool and sports facility and most of us eat breakfast together.  The pool is salt water so you never smell like chlorine and the hours are optimal with early risers and late night swim ops.  Breakfast is so good and the wait staff remember us from previous years.  Carlos is the best!  He asks after all the family and anticipates our needs.  He even remembered my favorite omelet and brought it to me so I did not have to wait in line.  Great service and lovely accommodations.

I've had the opportunity to stay at this property several times on business and have never been dissapointed.  The service upon check in has always been great, the rooms are very nice, on this recent trip got upgraded to a suite and it was very nice.  Nice lobby, nice bar/restaurant and very convenient location.  Being part of a health club is another plus if you should feel so inclined to have a workout.  Overall, when in the area, this property is always at the top of my list to stay at.....

Summary Heading: Active lifestyle, new hotel, great amenities
Summary: This newer hotel is great for active lifestyles and is kid fun friendly. Standard room was nicely appointed, comfortable but the grounds are the attraction. With the Club Sport fitness club attached, it is bustling with activity but still quiet. Great pools, arranged activities and awesome kids play area. Really great experience for an affordable price. Excellent value. Easy access the the toll road and very friendly staff. Don't miss the smoothies in the lobby cafe after a workout.

Summary Heading: Solid hotel especially for active business travelers
Summary: If you're into being active, it's all right here at this hotel.  There is an excellent health club built into the hotel so take advantage of it.  Rooms are nice, there is also pretty good food/drink.  The location is great....easy to get to Laguna Beach, Laguna Niguel, etc...

Spacious room that is clean and of high standard. A safe would be handy, and the glass in the bathroom door is a nuisance at night, when others are trying to sleep. Very very quiet room, large shower, plus a comfortable bed, so three major ticks for that! Not sure why there is a parking fee in this location but that is the way of many hotels these days I suppose. Great gym and pool area. The only reason I did not rate it 5 stars was the one day returning at 5pm to find the room not cleaned. When I called the Front Desk, the lady asked if I wanted it done "right away" Duhhhhhh!

Renaissance has created the perfect atmosphere for any hotel guest. This hotel is quiet, however located in an area that is extremely close to grocery stores, restaurants and various stores. The gym has something for everyone, whether you want to play basketball or use the fitness equipment. I went with my family & we needed to pick up some items from Trader Joes which is less than five minutes away, there is also a movie theatre & a TJ Maxx! Last, but definitely not least, the personnel at this hotel are amazing. They are so on top of their game, you basically don't have to request things from them, they have you covered from the beginning. I must point out the rooms are spacious, the beds are comfy & the bathrooms are so modern I loved it. We had two rooms that were right next

Excellent accomodation rooms higher standard no reusable bedcovers all fresh and clean. Bathroom had just a shower, but great one at that. We booked 7 rooms all were in great condition. Full blown SportsClub Facility included, as others reviewers said mainly a SportsClub, although they have a Kids Play and Pool area. Everybody in our group said again to this property.

Summary: The facility itself is fine but keep in mind that this is a health club first and a hotel second. There were a number of gym members using the pool during our stay with friends and family even though they were not staying at the hotel. When we checked in, we asked if any suite upgrades were available because we really needed more space. Unfortunately, we were told that none were available. When I signed into my Marriott App on my cell phone, I was able to book both a junior suite and an executive suite, so the front desk staff instantly lost all credibility. As a result, we will probably never stay here again. We still love Renaissance properties, just not this location.

Summary Heading: Best hotel for active healthy adults!
Summary: The title says it all, this is a full service health and fitness tesort with a hotel attached, not the other way around. Where else can you wake up to see 20 folks doing a coached workout in the Olympic saline pool at 6am. This is triathlete heaven, you will be surrounded by the best in Orange County as they swim, bike, run, TRX, Power Train, Bootcamp, or for a change of scenery head out from the club on a 4-18 mile trail run on the paved Aliso Creek Trail or the challenging Aliso Trails to top of the world with sunrise or sunset views of Laguna Beach below. The only two knocks on the property are 1) the rooms don't have patios so your stinky running shoes have nowhere to hide, and 2) the A/C only goes down to 67F which, if you come from back east, is far too hot a temperature

I was here for a week and it was very convenient to my office in Laguna Niguel.  My room was very clean and I liked the big walk in shower.  I wish I had more opportunity to use the workout facilities, as it's basically a big gym attached to a decent  hotel.   I was happy to get the free breakfast every morning - a little better than what you'd get at a Residence Inn - I guess with the health focus of this place, it was nice to get something like steel cut oatmeal at the restaurant.   Plenty of places to eat in the area as well and a Trader Joes 5 minutes away for any snacks and groceries.  Only real complaint was a little bit of attitude I got when I told the check in staff I was leaving a day early.  I was told I needed to have done that  24 hours before I left, rather than

Summary Heading: Still love this hotel, but major charge for parking
Summary: This is the fifth year my family and I have stayed at RCS Aliso Viejo. It is a first class hotel which I've left a previous glowing review for, so you can look that up if you want to. We still love this hotel, but this is the first year we were charged to park. The fee is $15 a night. Sorry, but that's a bitter pill to swallow when you're staying 3 nights, have already been jacked on airline baggage fees (family of 4), long term parking at the airport, and rental car extras thrown in at the last minute. C'mon Renaissance! You're bigger than this. Bottom line: this hotel is top notch in every respect, and as long as we continue to visit family in this area we will stay here. However, I wanted to make the readership aware of this new parking fee. If you're traveling on a tight

We came here for a family event and were pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was.  The reception was efficient and pleasant.  The shower area was large with no tub, which was not a problem for us.  We did not have the chance to use the fitness club nor the swimming pool that you could lap swim.  The small restaurant has a decent but small buffet breakfast for $16.00.  The lunch menu had imaginative choices and were delicious.  There is a $15.00 charge for parking which I am not quite sure why.  The adjoin garage seemed quite empty, but maybe it was the weekend.

Summary Heading: Only one night but want to return ASAP
Summary: Unfortunately was only here for one night on business but if I am back in the area again soon I will stay here for sure.   Check in and parking was a breeze.  Everyone very nice and helpful.  Room was big and modern.  Love the no tub shower.  I think all hotels need to do this.  Had a nice view on the 6th floor.  Didn't hear a peep from neighbors or anything all night. Having a gym onsite is huge.  Lap pool and normal pools as well are nice.  The bar / restaurant area is a good time.  Lively and bartenders / waitstaff very friendly.  Menu for both drinks and food was extensive and think everyone will find something they like.  Outdoor area at night is chill and laid back with fire pits, couches and tables.    Definitely recommend this place to anyone.  I hope to go back again

Spent two nights on business in Aliso Viejo and was plangently l pleasantly surprised at the room quality and location for the more than reasonable price of a Southern California hotel. The room was modern, well-appointed and completely wired for all my tech needs. The bar resident was convenient and friendly. I was not aware of the magnitude of the on site gym and workout facilities. Next time I'm adding workout gear to my suitcase.

Summary Heading: Expected more from the Marriott Brand
Summary: We stayed at this hotel just this weekend and plan to never come back. Upon arrival on a Friday night, we checked in at the front desk. It was hard to hear the associate considering the bar/restaurant was incredibly noises and it was "conveniently" placed in the hotel's lobby. Our room seemed fine at first but unfortunately the walls are paper thin. I could hear our neighbors closing drawers, slamming things and even coughing. To say the least I didn't get very much sleep. In the morning, we got breakfast at hotel's restaurant which was very good at all (additionally I gave the server my card that I wanted charged and then he ended it up transferring it to the room bill anyways, not with my request). Later on we went to Disney land and paid close to fifteen dollars worth of
Manager Response: Dear Becky K,  Thank you for choosing the Renaissance ClubSport Hotel.  We appreciate your opinion and honest feedback. Summary: I really like this hotel.  The rooms are immaculate and well-designed, the fitness club is massive, and the pool area is welcoming.  The poolside grill has a nice selection of salads at lunchtime, and the indoor restaurant (with patio overlooking the pool) is great for breakfast.  Service throughout the hotel was consistent and professional during my visit, with top marks going to the valet guys.

We were a bit surprised by how nice the hotel was.  We were driving through the area and needed a hotel at the last minute and they had rooms available.  The lobby F&B was reasonably priced and the kids liked the food quality.  They have a basketball court which the kiddos also thought was super cool.  Overall decor was great and customer service was outstanding.

Reasonable hotel. Bed is quite comfortable. Fancy gym. Outdoor full laps pool is nice. Breakfast is good, esp. The omelette. Check in can be challenging as they have a small front desk. Staff are attentive but can have quite a bit of wait. Not sure why that is.

Love this convenient hotel with a sporty feel, it has everything you want for a family getaway, the gym is beautiful, the kids club is huge and the spa is fantastic. Only drawback, I hate double beds, I wish they were queens and that the patio seating in Citrus allowed kids at night, but you're close to a lot of great places!

Nice staff and room; however, the walls are paper thin (noisy neighbors) and the breakfast buffet was not good (flavorless scrambled eggs and under done pancakes that I ordered.) I have to stay there again because my company uses them but not really looking forward to it.

Summary: We found this hotel while searching for something in the Laguna Beach area for an event we were attending.  Not knowing much about the area, I relied on the name and Marriott affiliation.  Good choice.  It is a very modern and up scale location, with reasonable prices and all the accommodations you might want in a hotel property.  While I didn't have time to use many of the amenities available (lounge, bar, pool, etc) I did notice that they were well attended by others and staff seemed comfortable and friendly with the guests.  My interaction with front door staff, front desk staff, and others throughout the building was nothing but great.  They all seemed happy in their jobs and pleasant to be around. Summary: We used to live in southern California so when we were able to set up a trip we were thrilled to find a great deal at this hotel. The ironic thing is we used to be members of the gym and so it felt like we were back at home. The pool and gym is great and it provides a great spot. We booked our trip via Expedia which I would never recommend.   The room we booked via Expedia was not what we received. We were told we would have a room with double beds, with separate sitting area, fridge and microwave. When we arrived, we were told there were not double beds available (hotel had been booked for 3 weeks) and none of the other items as well. After 2 talks with the hotel and 1 call with Expedia, we were given a junior suite which I suppose was roomier but definitely didn't make up for

Summary: If you love to explore high-energy, high-intensity, ultra-fun workout classes...and a lovely hotel, this is the place for you!  It is a more intimate hotel, not too large, and does not have a lounge, but  nonetheless the accommodations are one of the best! My wife and I stay here four to five weekends a year mostly for the gym...specifically the workout classes that you can participate in. It is also a great place to bring your entire family.  Our friend brought their two kids and they all simply loved the experience!  The pool is amazing! If you are ever in the vicinity, you should definitely consider this hotel.

We have had several extended stays at this hotel and it just keeps getting better.  All the staff is extremely friendly and helpful.  Twice we brought our whole family and all ages enjoyed the sports club, food, and rooms.
Manager Response: Dear Vicki K,  Thank you for your very kind review.  We look forward to seeing you again soon at the Renaissance ClubSport Hotel.  Sincerely,  Michael Robby Director of Hotel Sales

Summary Heading: A good choice if you have to be in Aliso Viejo
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for five nights as a result of a work commitment in Aliso Viejo. It's an interesting concept that we hadn't encountered before, a mixture of gym, resort and hotel, but it all worked well together.  We had two different rooms, moving from our first room after some noisy neighbour issues, both of which were large, clean and comfortably furnished. It might be an idea if they dedicated a floor or at least an area of rooms to business customers, not everyone is staying there to party...  Breakfast buffet was OK and the couple of evening meals we tried were also alright, at least the menu is full of healthy options, unusually. The pool, spa, gym, etc facilities appeared to be first class and very well used.  The hotel is around 15 minutes walk to Aliso town

I love these Renaissance Marriotts. Always super clean, modern and with incredible fitness facilities. Too bad there aren't more. Facilities were excellent, rooms nice and clean and cold. Pools and gym terrific. Food options were healthy and tasty. Weekend night outdoor bar had great music and vibe for parents when kids were asleep. Only issue were some families who let their kids roam the halls as if it was an extension of their room. Otherwise, great service and location. Would visit again.

My girlfriend and I loved our stat here. We stayed in the junior suite and loved the extra space in the room.  The bed is extremely comfortable and the bathroom was very spacious.   I enjoyed the state of the art gym. It was our first renaissance club sport and we definitely enjoyed the gym and workout room for a morning workout.   Would definitely stay here again and the young man at the front desk that checked me in and out I believe was amazing. I unfortunately darn it do not recall his name which I normally do.

Summary Heading: Great gym, pool & cafe, not best sleeping experience
Summary: On the positive side, the gym, pool and health oriented cafe at this hotel are awesome and I would have greatly appreciated them during the 15 years I traveled on business almost every week.  The actual room experience was not as great.  The pillows were very hard and I never got comfortable, my room was right above an area where all of the things keeping the hotel running are apparently stored because I heard noises all night, and if one of us got up to use the bathroom the entire room was flooded with light.  This couldn't be avoided because the bathroom light went on automatically and the door is glass.  Even if I was traveling alone I believe a bright light in my face at 3am would make it difficult to fall back to sleep.

Summary Heading: Another great stay for a very independent traveler
Summary: I stayed for 3 nights on business.  I love this hotel and wish I traveled more for work so I could stay more often!  I can't beat the location with my office down the street and tons of restaurant, grocery, shopping, etc options just down the hill.  The attached gym is the icing on the cake.  The gym is nicer than my local gym and its free and opens at 4am for us East coasters!  The quick service coffee/smoothie bar opens at 6am and has some great healthy quick service items as well, like hard boiled eggs, salads, cereals.  I did not eat at the restaurant so I can't comment. As for the rooms, they're fine.  But I'm of the opinion, I need a bed, alarm clock, lights and a bathroom.  Wifi was fine on the 2nd floor and I carry a cat5 cable with me for getting email quickly to my

Nice hotel and fairly well maintained. It has a huge fitness facility attached. Located amongst some office buildings and there is some nice outdoor shopping areas and chain restaurants nearby. Location is off a toll road. That is a little annoying for travellers as there are no toll takers. You have to go on a webstie and fill out a form to pay your tolls. Parking is in an unattached garage and $10 a day self park and $20 a day valet.

I stayed Mon-Fri last week for a conference and it was one of the worst experiences I've had in a long time.  One particular front desk staff had an attitude whenever I made a simple request.    When you enter your room, the staff very kindly leaves an apple in a glass dish for you to eat.  I grabbed the apple to snack on the day after I checked in and someone took a huge bite out of it and put it back in the dish, bite side down.  I calmly went downstairs and there were two men standing by the front desk.  When I told the manager in charge about the apple incident, his first response was "Well I hope you don't have a beef with anyone here."  I didn't say anything and just stared at him dumbfounded until he realized his mistake and he quickly corrected himself.  He said he would

Summary: We checked in easily, got our keys and then found that the keys did not work; Luckily, a representative from housekeeping was nearby ( their room on the floor was directly across from our room) who let us in and arranged to have key delivered. Unfortunately, the housekeeping room was directly across from our room and the door was open a lot in the early evening (8-11p) and a lot of loud conversations were heard. We ordered room service as the kids wanted desert. The cookies were stale and the RS rep spilled my wine before delivering it to me. Promised to return ASAP (actually came 25 min later) and stated that it was on the house. it wasn't. Finally, the room came with a pull out sofa bed, however there was no linen in the closets and we had to call to have sheets brought in and

Summary Heading: Came for a Wedding, left without my personal items and a chunk of money
Summary: The room is nice, but they try to be so trendy that many things are not functional. Got a roll away, worked great unless you wanted to lay on it. Warning, do not leave personal items out, came back from the wedding to find all of the shoe boxes, suit and dress covers (placed in the closet) thrown away. Finally, ask about parking before you do so - $100 for three days parking. Good service as well.  About 15 mins walk to the town centre and 20 mins to Anaheim Disneyland by cab without traffic.

Staff was friendly and gracious.  There were a few downsides.  Despite a large showerhead in the European-style shower, the flow was weak. Our second stay wasn't as good as the first. As occurred on our last weekend stay the hotel was hosting a wedding and so was busy. However staff numbers seemed to need boosting. Summary: Stayed there for a couple of weeks.... Staff is very friendly and helpful... Rooms are spacious, well maintained and timely room service.. complimentary wi-fi is pretty fine... Pools side facing rooms get good sunlight and view of the city.... Food is kind of pricey, but good... Overall ambiance is pleasant- always... Only complaint if any for the rooms would be on the 'not-so-friendly' menu options-description of TV channels... but that's probably a universal issue there... Location wise very close to the Town Center for regular shopping....  Overall a very good experience, strongly recommend especially for business trips

Summary Heading: Spa, hotel, gym, all in one!
Summary: I agree with the other reviewer who called this place a gym with a hotel attached. That's not to say it's a bad thing. Great amenities. I thoroughly enjoyed the spa services, the hot tubs, and the salt water pool. The menu in the restaurant and on the patio was more diverse (enough to please any person, whether they're watching their diet or not) and more reasonably priced than I expected, and the whole menu is available for room service. The hotel is in kind of a strange location (set in a sort of business park), but once inside the hotel or at the outdoor pool, it's easy to imagine you're at a secluded resort hotel.

Summary Heading: Loved the atmosphere, perfect for a quiet weekend!
Summary: I stayed here for 3 nights in March and loved my stay...for a fitness conscious person, I really enjoyed waking up and going for a leisurely swim in the lap pool followed by breakfast outside.  It was EXACTLY what I needed.  The food was convenient and satisfying...nothing to write home about but got the job done when in a hurry.  Definitely wouldn't be my top choice for a big family looking to stick their kids in the pool but for a solo traveler it was in just the location I needed.

Summary: Interesting hotel.  Like another reviewer mentioned, it is a fitness center/spa that happens to have hotel rooms.  I was there on business and if you need some incentive to get to pass up the cheeseburger/steak dinner and get up early and work out, this is the place for you.  The 485 calorie dinner salad was remarkably delicious and filling.  The service was good and the outdoor patio dining was a nice touch. I was somewhat surprised (pleasantly) at the number of families with small kids. So not an "adult retreat" but a good place for families or a "girls" weekend.

My in-laws stayed here during their visit to CA and they loved it. My mother-in-law, who is an avid Marriott customer (and has very discerning taste), said that it was their favorite Marriott hotel yet. They were upgraded to the "sweet" and found it spacious, quiet and comfortable. The room was modern with a nice bathroom and upscale toiletries.   It's located in a business park, but about 3 blocks away from a huge mall with lots of restaurants. The lobby is fresh and inviting and their bar/restaurant has a beautiful patio to sit and have drinks by the fire.I've gone back to the bar just to take friends to happy hour there. I didn't actually work out in the gym/pool, but they looked amazing!   My in-laws already have plans to visit again and they're excited to stay at the

Sitting amid a sprawling business park in south Orange County, the Renaissance ClubSport Aliso Viejo Hotel is quite unusual.  While most hotels have a gym, this is a gym that happens to have a hotel attached to it.  Upon entering the hotel, the lobby is bright and open.  The gym is located to the left, while the hotel is on the right.  There is a restaurant in the middle of the lobby towards the back.  The front desk is located to the right.  There is one small front desk area and if there weren’t a “HOTEL” sign posted one could easily walk right past it.  Upon check-in my Ritz Carlton Platinum Elite status was recognized. Summary: From the front desk staff at check-in to the patio servers all were very friendly and helpful. One minor issue with the room prompted immediate response and top notch remedy. They were all very interested in making the stay pleasant. I will definitely return.

Our family had a fantastic stay here recently.  The hotel staff was outstanding.  We dealt primarily with CJ Richards who was extremely helpful during our stay.  I called for some extra towels and there was somebody at the hotel room door in what seemed like less than a minute.  The rooms are clean and bright, as well as the rest of the hotel.    The gym connected to the hotel (free for guests) is large (huge really) and very well equipped (much better than the gym I go to at home).  There are two pools, a lap pool and a family pool as well as a nice spa.  We only ate at the breakfast buffet which was good.  The buffet included the usual -oatmeal, muffins, bacon, srambled.eggs, bagels, bread, yogurt, cereal, as well as made to order omelets. The service at the buffet was also

(Once I brought this to their attention a fridge with brought up to the room within an hour.)  We had been lucky our flight from Boston was not cancelled due the storm. We were welcomed to CA with temps of 70+ and beautiful sunshine instead of the snow mess back home. We had travel here with my son's gymnastics team for a competition. My son was scheduled to compete this morning at 8am. Well that did not happen. Yesterday morning he eat the scrambled eggs and drunk milk from the hotel buffet. We would like to take time as well, to clarify a few of the statements made in regard to the above review.  The sanitation and cleanliness of both our food preparation and presentation is of the utmost importance to us here at Renaissance ClubSport. We follow very strict guidelines and have always implemented policies and procedures to maintain our excellent standards of practice.   While you stated that your son had unfortunately had fallen ill during your vacation here, what fails to be mentioned is that we did strongly suggest that you visit a local medical facility for any treatment that may have been necessary at that time given his illness. Our Manager on Duty that weekend offered to help coordinate a local doctor; however, you graciously declined.  As stated within your review, and truly, whether being at Renaissance ClubSport, or anywhere else, if you deemed this to be food poisoning, and given the severity of his condition, surely this would have been considered a medical emergency. As we do not utilize a standard copy and paste response to our reviews, we simply state the many reasons that one may fall ill when traveling across North America. As we are a service- oriented business, listening to each of our guests’ comments is certainly of extreme importance to us. That said, we do hope that your son is feeling better now, and we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.   Sincerely,  Edward J. Tomlin General Manager Renaissance ClubSport

Summary: I have stayed at Marriott Properties in various places to include Marriott Vacation Club in Spain, Costa del Sol Area. Never had a compliant and this property was not about to let my expectations down. From the moment you arrive; service is the number one priority of its employees. From opening doors and welcoming you into the nice lighted lobby to the fashion displayed all around from the check-in-desk to the elevators. No detail has gone unnoticed in this Oasis. I had the one night free for using and having my credit card with Marriott opened and of course having my account in good standing. I decided to take advantage of this free night and go ahead and stay for an extra night. I made the right decision by choosing this hotel. The room was spacious and the queen-size bed was

I've stayed at many Marriott hotels,  but had not yet experienced a ClubSport. I was impressed all-around!   I go to the gym on a regular basis and the equipment I like to use is typically not available in hotel fitness centers. This hotel's on site gym had more amenities than even most private fitness clubs. Outstanding facility and impressive locker rooms.   Even if you not a gym-goer,  the hotel was awesome. The lobby bar had quite a weekend night life for a hotel tucked away in Aliso Viejo. I loved the lighting and design, from the lobby to the rooms.   Most of all,  I was impressed with the service.  Every member of the hotel was very friendly and willing to help without hesitation. I hope to get the chance to stay here again.

I stayed here for a weekend in July because I had a free Marriott award (so 1 night was free) and needed to use it but didn't have time to travel too far from home. This hotel is fantastic for a quiet weekend getaway. Everything about it was new and fresh. Having spent 75% of my time that weekend at the hotel I can honestly say I was pleased with all of it.   The room was large and comfortable. It had a cute little chaise by the window that I laid on and read for hours. The bathroom was also large and because the whole hotel has a healthy lifestyle theme there were little dumbbells in the bathroom if you wanted to work out in your room.  The room service menu had pretty much all healthy options but if you wanted to indulge you just had to ask and they had it. I ordered the

Summary Heading: Very cool property in the heart of Orange County, Ca
Summary: I had my first stay at this very nice property complete with a full fitness club attached.  It is minutes from the Laguna Beach area and about 20 minutes from John Wayne Airport (SNA).  It is quite unique in that there really is a GIANT member's fitness club available to hotel guests as well - a full outdoor olympic swimming pool included...  The rooms were nicely appointed with very comfortable mattresses, linens and pillows.  It also had free wireless internet access included with very good speed.  I could Facetime with no issues.  It also includes a walk-in shower with a giant shower head in the ceiling.  The front desk staff was very friendly.  Breakfast was quite tasty albeit an expensive buffet if not included in the rate ($18 with tip).  I also ate lunch during this

I needed to get out to Aliso Viejo to see my daughter who just delivered her first child. Normally i stay closer to Irvine area, but since the Renaissance was so close i decided to try it. What a great value for the money. The room was bright and clean. Bathroom especially!!  bed was confortable..The hotel itself is a hotel connected to a very large fitness center. Had a great workout and enjoyed the breakfast bar area in the lobby of the hotel. Only thing would be to lose the Vegas style thumping music early in the morning!!! overall its a good location right off the 73 tollway.  I would definitiely stay there again.

My recent stay was every bit as enjoyable as my previous ones to this unique hotel.  The property boasts a wonderful athletic club with the best-equipped fitness room that I have encountered at any hotel.  Classes are available, as is an Olympic-sized outdoor swimming pool.  I absolutely love the women's shower/locker area with a large indoor steam bath, dry sauna, and jacuzzi, as well as areas to dry hair and put on make-up.  The hotel rooms are spacious and clean, although I wish the bathroom had a tub rather than just a doorless shower.  If you have to get up during the night, you may find it hard to get used to the automatic lights that come on when you enter the bathroom area.  The hotel has a wonderful restaurant that offers many healthy meal options, as well as a nice bar

Summary Heading: Great place for business and workout
Summary: My wife and I spent New Years Eve here to get away from the hustle and bustle of parties. Very quite and clean. Customer Service was excellent!!! Eva made our weekend stay awesome! We really want to return but would request a suite next visit. Workout center, spa and bar are all up to date and well taken care of.

As an elite Marriott member, my wife and I were upgraded to a Jr. Suite.  Aside from being a very large room, there was not anything special about the Jr. Suite.  The bed was extremely comfortable and the room and floor was quite.  I give the room 5 stars.  The experience at the restaurant / bar was very different.  I went to get a beer to take back up to my room and it took too long for the bartender to acknowledge my presence and get me a beer.  The bar was a bit crowded, but a quick acknowledgement of eye contact to let me know would have been a common gesture. Summary Heading: Great service and very clean hotel.
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for one night in December 2013. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The decor was modern and the entire hotel was very clean. Our room was comfortable and the bathroom was fairly roomy. There are two pools. One is a family pool and the other is a lap pool. We only used the whirlpool, which was very nice. There was supposedly a sauna and a steam room but we couldn't find either. We did not eat at the restaurant or order room service. I would definitely stay here again.

Stay here often for business.  Great friendly staff that always remembers my name, awesome gym nice pool. The rooms are not overly nice but they are extremely clean and comfortable.  Just not a wow factor.   Food at the bar is awesome and healthy.  The healthy shakes at the nutrition bar are insane. Yum yum.

I only got to stay here one night sadly, but I definitely would love to come back again!  This has to be one of my all time favorite hotels. The staff is amazing!  The rooms are very clean and modern.  I love the style and decor.  The views and the whole area are just beautiful.  They have an amazing workout facility and beautiful pools.  The food is delicious, and they have great options for those that are health conscious.  I literally can't say enough good things about this place.

Summary: Great facilities, nice clean and large rooms, an amazing gym, poolside area, not to mention a good bar, cafe and restaurant all in one. And free wi-fi.  Plenty of off street parking, and the gym. Once again, ive never seen a more diverse place with top class instructors/equipment , and a plethora of training options iuncluding dance, boxing, basketball etc

This Hotel has everything that you need! The room is nice and cozy. Fairly clean. You have fitness center with shower, jacuzzi, and sauna :) The lobby restaurant is really nice and food is decent. Next to the restaurant, The bar atmosphere is relaxing and trendy as well. I had a good time there.

Summary Heading: Only go if you have time to wait around.
Summary: I had booked an appointment for my son and I to go check out this gym, as we are looking for a family gym and this is close and convenient. I made the appointment with "Joy" online to come in and take the tour and find out about the amenities offered. My son and I showed up on time at 4:30. We were greeted by someone on the hotel side. I gave my name and she asked me to take a seat. My son and I waited for 20 minutes, with no one coming to offer us a drink or that the woman would be late. Nothing! So finally, my son and I walk out, asking the front to comp our valet since we did not meet with her. Very unprofessional. Then she had the audacity to text me at 5:02 after we left to ask where I was. Joy did not make me feel very "joyful" and did not represent her company well.

Summary: This hotel exceeded our expectations by a long shot. I am so surprised it hasn't received any commentary in years!  After booking what seemed to be a decent and reputable hotel name in Dana Point for a more expensive price, upon arrival, we felt incredibly deceived and disgusted. It was so bad, I had to cancel the rest of the reservations that were due to fly in the next day because I was so embarrassed.   I made one call and spoke to the manager, Malinda, and she was able to book my family seven rooms within 20 minutes without any ebbs or long holds on the phone. She was confident and assuring; just what we needed after a night in a dump.  The rooms are clean and roomy, staff is incredibly hospitable and we received impeccable customer service throughout our stay. The gym is

We have always stayed in an ocean view accomodation, but decided to try something different. This was a great change. We used the gym (excellent facilities!) several times, ate breakfast each morning in their restaurant, and even made an attempt at using the Kid's Quest. (no fault of the hotel-the little guy was having nothing to do with it.) The rooms are clean and the beds are top-notch. We were given a 2 pm checkout which allowed us to get in another workout. We found many nice places to eat closeby. One of the other reviews had mentioned finding a quiet spot downstairs. I agree that this was not possible, but I could always head up to my room. The wifi does seem to be an issue & did not stay connected. Services during our stay were excellent. They had charged us for parking

Lively & Energetic, this hotel has everything you would want, whether you are traveling for business or pleasure. The only continued disappointment is the poor WiFi in the lobby area. It doesn't reach outside on the patio, or pool area, and for business travelers wanting to work, this is unacceptable.

The gym at this hotel is fabulous!!! If you stay at the hotel, you get full access to the gym and can even attend their amazing classes. The pool is nice and relaxing with a full service bar.  Restaurants are within walking distance.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel for the price
Summary: Ratings all hold up. Room was very fashionable. Location is not far from alot of places in Orange County. Amenities include an onsite state of the art fitness center with instructors, workout classes, etc.

Was here for just one night. Rooms are decent and the restaurant 'Citrus' has some great menu dishes. Was not able to use the sport facilities due to work pressure.   Not so good - about 60 miles away from LAX - took me 4 hours to get there by shuttle and 90 minutes to go back to the airport by private cab at 3 AM !! It is in the middle of nowhere. If you don't have a car, think again.   I was here because of its proximity to Soka University where I had an annual meeting to attend. The Valet were excellent.  House keeping needs improvement - the bathroom was not well cleaned when i checked in.
Manager Response: Dear frankview,  Thank you for writing this review, we appreciate your compliments as well as your honest feedback.  Here at Renaissance ClubSport we constantly strive for customer service excellence in everything we do, every day, with every hotel guest.  We are always looking for ways to improve our service, guestroom amenities, as well as the arrival experience - especially for our international guests who have arrived after a very long journey.  That said, we will follow up on the information you have shared, and we sincerely hope to see you again as our hotel guest during a future visit to this area.  Safe travels and take good care.  Sincerely,  Michael Robby Senior Hotel Sales Manager michael.robby@clubsports.com

Summary: Stayed in this hotel for a few times and overall i liked it. Thus i would say that they should be less expensive and provide better offers for a regular clients. The gym, the spa and overall fitness facilities are fantastic. The hotel mark is 5, value for money - 4!
Manager Response: Dear BJNY81,  Thank you for your review, we appreciate your feedback, and thanks for staying with us!  Here at Renaissance ClubSport we are constantly looking for ways to keep our hotel rates and offers as competitive as possible for our loyal guests and clientele.  Our trend-setting "Look No Further® Best Rate Guarantee" is one of the best in the business. It assures that you’ll always get the best rate available when you book directly with Marriott® and Renaissance Hotels. We're glad to assist you in the future, and hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Michael Robby Senior Hotel Sales Manager michael.robby@clubsports.com

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel every trip back to the office, prob once a month for 3 days. The hotel itself is clean, it almost doesnt feel like a hotel, more like a gym with a place to sleep. Working in the lobby or finding some quiet time to eat a dinner or breakfast forget about it. Hey if your into all that then perfect hotel for you. If you plan on booking this hotel on a rate that says something like free breakfast for 2 or whatever call and make sure, they will not honor anything, and seem to fight the notion that your rate says included. Overall thou the rooms are clean, so spend some time in your room.
Manager Response: Dear Josh,  Thanks for submitting your review, as well thanks for being a loyal, frequent hotel guest.  We appreciate your business and partnership.  Here at Renaissance ClubSport we are always looking for ways to enhance your guest experience, and find creative solutions to delight with a personal touch. Kindly let us know the next time you are coming into town, and we'll make it your best stay yet.  Thanks again for choosing Renaissance ClubSport.  Sincerely,  Michael Robby Senior Hotel Sales Manager michael.robby@clubsports.com

Summary Heading: Would be more comfortable with queen beds
Summary: Stayed last weekend at this hotel for a soccer tournament. I especially like the sports theme with lots of large screen TVs on different sports channels by the Starbucks café and bar. The Starbucks is great and convenient for a quick breakfast. The beds are too soft for my liking and would have really liked Queen beds instead of Doubles. The location of the hotel is actually quite convenient even though it seems like it is in the middle of an office park. Just drive downhill on Enterprise and there are lots of  restaurants and supermarkets for groceries.

Summary Heading: Unique niche hotel but made for nice leisure stay
Summary: Although the hotel seems to cater to the specific niche of health conscious business travelers, we had a good short leisure stay with the kids.  Room was very nice. Restaurant was good and with a health-conscious leaning. Amenities were very nice. Price was good for quality/location. Only complaint was that 3/4 of the large outdoor pool was permanently marked off for lap swimming for the health club.

Reserved two doubles but none available on check in. Was offered a king and rollaway but not a viable option for a family of four! Our two teenagers are as tall as we are! So offered to put two rollaways even though fire hazard and not supposed to but Manager willing to override! Not a good start to a check in! Supposed to have a view but when look at pool have to look at rooftop a/c units so.. Glad we are only here for a night!

Summary Heading: Not on the main drag but great value
Summary: This hotel is a bit of a hybrid -- half hotel, half sports club.  The sports club is used by locals, so there's a lot of coming and going in the lobby.  Parking is plentiful (but they charge $10/day), and the location is only 10-15 minutes from downtown Laguna.  It's very convenient when visiting the Playhouse, Pageant of the Masters, etc., but out of the center of town madness.  The rooms are very typical Marriott/Renaissance rooms, with great feather pillows, comfortable bed, etc., but there is no mini fridge.  It's also the only hotel I've ever stayed in which only provides two bath towels.  It wasn't a problem; just strange.  There are loads of fitness classes, two pools and a spa with all the massage options -- even weights on the shelves in the bathroom.  The only problem

Summary Heading: ULTIMATE HOTEL EXPERIENCE FOR A MODEST PRICE
Summary: I discovered this hotel when I bought a package deal that combined hotel, plane tickets, and rental car. The deal was so amazing, I didn't have high hopes for the hotel. Was I ever wrong! That was last October, and my family and I just returned home today from ANOTHER week's stay at Renaissance ClubSport in Aliso Viejo.  We love this place!!!!   First, the fitness aspect of it. As hotel guests, you are entitled to full use of the world class fitness club attached to the hotel. This isn't just some little room with a few free weights and a couple of treadmills. I'm talking dozens of classes, olympic like cardio equipment (too many to count), basketball courts,  lemon water, fresh towels, steam rooms, saunas, swimming pools, hot tubs....you just have to see it to believe it. And

This was quite a different style of Marriott than I have stayed at before.  Very hip feeling in the lobby.  Obviously a big push towards fitness and a fabulous gym.  Alas I was here for business in the area and I was in the property only 10 hours before leaving again.  The woman at the desk when I checked in was top notch.  She was handling many people checking in with incredible professionalism, friendly and efficient.  Wish I had asked her name to advise her manager what a great job she did ( I checked in Friday at around 10:30pm).  She alone was worth 4 stars!

If you like an absolute first class health club, this is the place! The room was very spacious and quiet and the staff professional. The food was very tasty and we enjoyed the free fruit and spa water very much.

Summary Heading: People are happy to work there and it shows
Summary: This place is all about Heath.  It is clean.  The prices of food and beverage are reasonable.  The people that work there seem truly happy.  It is not that put on fake feeling of trained customer service. They are very attentive.  There are a lot  of locals here that use the gym and stay later.  I can also say ( not from personal experience as I am happily married) but a lot of shall we say....uh...people find love..at least for one night...interesting to watch.

Summary Heading: Nowhere near the standards of a Renaissance.
Summary: I wanted to give this hotel one star, but added a second star due to the friendliness and prompt responsiveness of the staff.  There's very little good to tell here.  The location is excellent.  A short five minute car ride, or a good 15 minute walk to the Aliso Viejo Town Center, where there are many restaurants, including well known chains such as Romano's Macaroni Grill and Chilis, among others.  I would recommend Panini Cafe, for a delicious sampling of Mediterranean food.    The staff is incredibly friendly and responsive.  Another plus.  One other positive is the sumptuous breakfast buffet.  And if you are a Gold or Platinum Marriott Rewards member, it is free.  There was a lot of bad here.  First of all, I have stayed at Marriott Renaissance hotels before, and they are

Summary Heading: Great Property w/Many Amenities & Great Food
Summary: We had a little 1-night staycation here to decompress before getting back to the grind. The service and staff were great and the property has much to offer. Its got a newer more modern feel to it.  Our room overlooked the pool area and didn't feel cramped at all. There was even a chaise lounge chair next to the window. There was also a desk area, keurig coffee maker, flat screen tv, closet, safe and bathrobes. The bathroom was really nice with a glass door and rain shower. There were actually decent working blow dryers too. There were Aveda products in there as well. As far as our king size bed goes, I'm not sure if its a chain wide Marriott thing or not but the bed was on the firmer side, which for some might be fine but for me was a little difficult to get completely

We stayed here for one night over the busy fourth of July weekend.  The room was bright and sunny, with a great large shower.  Although the hotel was fully booked, it did not seem crowded.  We only used the pool during our stay - it was fine, but not a "resort" feeling pool area. The fitness club appeared to be top notch and was very busy with local residents and families.  We enjoyed the complimentary gold elite breakfast, which was very, very good.  It's a nice option in the area, fairly easy to get around.  Watch out for the toll road though, it gets pricey and have cash to pay.

Would highly recommend this hotel.  Staff is very professional.  Comfortable beds and very clean facility.  Breakfast buffet and a la carte menu are also really good (for the calorie-minded the 'a la carte' menu includes a great variety of low cal meals).  Favorites:  Flat breads (delicious) and soups.  Something that can be improved are the hair dryers in the guest rooms (little or no power).
Manager Response: Dear guillerkirita,  Thank you for staying with us at the Renaissance ClubSport.  We really appreciate your comments and feedback.  As you stated, our innovative Food and Beverage offerings in our Citrus Fresh Grill support a healthy lifestyle - for both hotel guests and our club members.  We are delighted to go beyond a basic full-service hotel experience for our guests, but also be your partner in wellness!  As well, we appreciate the feedback on the hair dryers and we'll see if perhaps we can offer a more powerful one for you on your next stay with us.  We hope to see you soon.  Sincerely,  Michael Robby Senior Hotel Sales Manager michael.robby@clubsports.com

Summary: I booked this stay for the 4th of July weekend with my son after staying at the one in walnut creek.   The renaissance sport in walnut creek was wonderful.  This one fell short of that mark.  Everything seemed a little worn down.   Spots on the carpet, the furniture in the room was older and worn and overall just not as sparkling as the one in walnut creek.   In was also frustrated that there was no enforcement of the lap swim.   while there is a family pool there were a bunch of kids playing in the lanes - and not just one lane they were jumping back and forth between lanes making it very difficult to do laps.  The hotel is nice but more of a three when compared to the one in walnut creek which was definitely five star.
Manager Response: Dear Beth W,  Thank you for staying with us over the busy holiday weekend.  We appreciate your candid feedback and please know we take your comments seriously in our continued quest to strive for customer service excellence, everyday - in everything we do.  Here at Renaissance ClubSport, we will continue to look for opportunities to improve the guest experience as well as keep our property looking top-notch.  There are some exciting initiatives happening now.  We hope you will give us another try soon, so we can impress you with all the splendor that is the true Renaissance ClubSport way.  Take good care and until next time...  Sincerely,  Michael Robby Senior Hotel Sales Manager michael.robby@clubsports.com

Summary: We arrived on June 28th, for a 2 day stay, we live in Lancaster CA, the weather forecast predicted 112 degrees there, so we escaped to cooler Aliso Viejo. The service is excellent, all the staff is very well trained. All the facilities are wonderful, including the pools. However the entire pool area was jam packed with small children, extremely loud, even the whirlpool was full of children around 6 year old, there were no seats available, all were taken. The Hotel advertises the pool and how wonderful it is, but they fail to mention that it is unbearable to spend any time there due to all the screaming children. The Hotel has some sort of membership for outsiders to use the facilities, since all these people came and went by car.   We were looking forward to a quiet weekend by a

Summary Heading: Beautiful and glamorous but not for a youth sports team
Summary: This was a very different experience. It's primary focus was the gym and secondary was the hotel. There are constantly regular gym members pulling up to valet park their cars during their workout. You can't. Access the lap pool without signing I. Which means kids can't come and go as they please. The gym is apparently top notch but I didn't have time to enjoy it being there with a kids sports team. The rooms are nice but the frosted glass doors on the bathroom don't allow parents to rise and not wake sleeping kids. The bathroom was large and clean but no good vent so it steamed up quickly.  We had a room with 2 beds but they were full size not queens so they were dinky for this 5'11 gal and my boyfriend. The sheets were a,azing.y amooth and soft. The Mattress and pillows were

I really wanted to like this hotel.  I enjoy working out when I travel and thought that this would be the perfect hotel to stay at.  The fitness club is top notch.  That part I liked.  However, the hotel lacks a level of professionalism that I expect from a Renaissance hotel.  The employees were friendly enough, but I felt that they needed some older more experienced professionals running the show.  Walls are really thin, so you can hear your neighbors which I didn't like.  Also, there are a lot of kids running around, which makes your stay less relaxing.  It was like booking a hotel at an elementary school.

Here at Renaissance, we consistently strive for excellence in every hotel guest interaction, while keeping your experience delightful from the moment you arrive.
