That said, we'd love to have you back with us again and we can ensure a more peaceful, exclusive experience in another part of our hotel tower. Again, thank you for choosing Renaissance ClubSport, and we hope to see you again soon !  Sincerely,  Michael Robby Senior Hotel Sales Manager michael.robby@clubsports.com

Summary Heading: Super chic mod small hotel with awesome gym !!
Summary: Small newer mod mid century vibe. Great pool area with kids pool n super soakers ! Easy location, great service, reall nice clean rooms. We got a suite which was wonderful !!! Very sweet...did hear slight noise from roof assume AC compressors over the bed however no issue sleeping, great yummy room service and awesome breakfast buffet !

Summary Heading: Fresh, modern hotel with fitness theme
Summary: Third stay in this nice property within the Renaissance, Marriott chain - with a fitness, spa and health club theme.   Property:  Attractive and modern lobby - open, fresh feel - including its bar and restaurant area, and very nice patio and outdoor seating.   Room floors and rooms show contemporary design and modern decor - bright, clean lines (not spare, but modern).   Fitness center clientele include large number of locals - which contributes to sense that you've booked into spa.  Not lux, but very nice.   Rooms: Rooms are well appointed, with comfortable beds and large, clean bathrooms (with large showers and no tub), and, again, modern design - e.g., clean lines, bright primary colors.  Staff:  Uniformly friendly, accommodating, professional.  Very good.    Food:  Quite

Summary Heading: Very helpful young staff in a fitness friendly environment
Summary: The welcome was genuine and all of the mostly young staff were enthusiastic and helpful during our overnight stay. The hotel is very comfortable and easy to get to find off the OC toll freeway. We were upgraded to a large junior suite and the room was very well equipped. The decor is consistent with the fitness theme of the large fitness centre attached to the hotel but is beginning to look dated. Breakfast which was enthusiastically described on check in was only adequate. The hotel is well located to much of Orange County, especially the Laguna area where hotels are much more expensive. On balance though very good value and would stay here again.

Nice building Excellent rooms Excellent concierge service Excellent front desk service Folks well trained on the Marriot hotel system. Very organized and timely billing Great executive lounge, attendant highly motivated. Overall hotel staff highly motivated, from the GM, to the gardener, housekeeper and Chef. This my favorite Renaissance hotel bar none, folks there are always happy to see you, and they are very courtious. I love this hotel. All Renaissancehotels in California  should their teams to this hotel for training, this Renaissance has the hotel customer service down pat.

I stayed at Club Sport during a recent visit to California. I was at the hotel for two nights. Service from the time I registered until I left was extremely accommodating.  At registration, Malinda asked if I was a member of AAA. Something I would not of thought to mention.  After showing my membership card, my room rate was reduced $30 dollars. The next morning, I found an unexpected voucher for breakfast, which was a lovely buffet with an omelette station.  Along with friends, I had dinner in their restaurant, Citrus. The food was adequate. However, our waiter must have missed a few classes on the art of waitering.  Among other things, he announced the specials after we had placed our orders.  When asked if I could change, he informed me that my order was already being

Summary Heading: You had me at salt water lap pool!
Summary: If you are the type of traveler that thinks a hotel gym should be more than a stationary bike and a treadmill in an empty hotel room this property is for you.  Food is excellent, service was top notch and the gym was amazing. I would go out of my way to stay here again!

I stayed here for a week on business.  The hotel provided everything I needed including a state of the art gym with every machine and classes available for no extra charge!  The bathroom was huge and included a makeshift bookshelf to hold stuff and spacious vanity by many hotel standards.  Towels were great, not the threadbare ones.    I did not eat at the restaurant, as I thought the prices were a bit steep and personally, I like to venture out.  There are many restaurants "down the hill" from the hotel, including a trader joe's.  There's a great self serve coffee bar behind the restaurant that offers quick breakfast options like hard boiled eggs, tuna salad, egg salad and single portion cereals and coffee of course.  It is staffed and options for lattes and shakes are

Summary: Stayed in this hotel a couple times with my family, i like fitness and gym in this hotel is really excellent. Hotel is relatively new and lobby in very nice as well as rooms. Food is ok (but not more), service is fine. The only note that the hotel is a bit overpriced for its value, especially when you are a long-stay guest they should have better offers.

Summary Heading: currently staying here, so far so good
Summary: Staying here on business, mostly having a positive experience.  Rooms very clean and modern - love the updated bathrooms.  There is a restaurant downstairs and the room service menu is great.  Also, there is the gym here which I have not visited.  The front desk has been excellent so far... I have had some issues and they remedy them quickly.  For example, my hair dryer was broken and they sent a brand new one up in about 10-15 minutes.  I attempted to purchase some soda from the vending machine and the machine ate my money and didn't give me any soda, so I called the front desk and they sent me up replacement soda.  I appreciate their willingness to try to please and right situations.  The bed is very comfortable, rooms a decent size. Minor complaints : SUPER thin walls, you

Summary Heading: Great stay especially if you are into fitness
Summary: The hotel is in the middle of business parks, retails, restaurants, all within couple minutes drive. Nice good looking contemporary lobby and room decor. Service was great with friendly staff. We had TV issue and the evening maintenance person tried everything he can to make sure we are totally satisfied with the new room we transferred to. They have a membership gym on site (FREE TO USE AS HOTEL GUEST), has everything there, its like a brand new LA Fitness with upgraded machines, clean plush towels, and friendly staff. They also have "kids club" babysitting service. Will bring our kids here next time.

The ClubSport is a strange place. I was never really sure if it was a health club, with a hotel attached or a hotel with a health club attached.  The health club facilities are excellent, better than in most dedicated health clubs. The rooms are basic fayre nothing to write home about, definitely nothing special. For the price I would expect a lot more.   I found the service throughout the hotel to be to the normal American standard, good but again nothing special. The buffet breakfast was excellent. For other eating probably best to go elsewhere as the choice is limited, but to a decent standard.  No complaints, but at the price not special enough.
Manager Response: Dear Rob,  Thank you for taking time to submit your review.  Indeed the Renaissance ClubSport is a very unique brand within the Marriott family of hotels which offers a world-class 75,000 square foot sports and fitness complex attached to our boutique hotel.  One of the tremendous value enhancements to our hotel guests is that access to the ClubSport facilities, including the massive health club, aquatic center, etc. - is on a completely complimentary basis during your stay with us! Sincerely,  Michael Robby Senior Hotel Sales Manager michael.robby@clubsports.com

Summary: Stayed 4 nights. Let me start with the good: wonderful customer service at front check in desk and breakfast buffet. Very comfortable bed, linens, and overall accommodations. Not a fan of the bright color scheme for the hotel, but didn't impact my stay. Lol. Now the other:  when I arrived on Sunday afternoon valets were no where to be found, with random cars parked and blocking ability to enter or exit. During my first night I heard the door next to my room open then slam several times; it literally shook the wall and woke me from a dead sleep. In the morning I noticed the door beside me was to a storage room. When the slamming started again on my second night, I counted 5 slams then stuck my head out and asked the young man if he would mind NOT slamming the door again. He was

The rooms are clean, modern and the sports club etc seems great. However if a good night's sleep is what you want, don't stay here. You may as well all be in the room based on the soundproofing - this isn't about hearing loud TVs, you can hear someone COUGH next door. I felt like I was in the same room as the people staying next to me.

Unfortunately, my stay was very short and I could not take advantage of all the amenities (sports club, pools, machines, etc.).  I arrived late on a Wednesday night when the hotel was close to a sell-out, but they upgraded me.  They had just unveiled a new menu at the bar and restaurant, which was great.  Front desk and food and beverage personnel were great.  The sports club was in use all night and early AM, it seemed.  Will go back again when I can use more of the facilities.  Guest room was clean and modern.  Thanks to all.

Summary Heading: Alright, but a little pricey for the quality
Summary: I've been trying different hotels in the OC area for a few months of trips lately and the ClubSport rolled around this time.  The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly - so the basics were met.  The room was sparsely decorated, but the bathroom was a bit odd: no towel racks and instead what looked like a book case in the corner used as towel storage.  The shower was large and had a rainfall shower head - very nice.  The focus here is definitely on the gym, as suggested in the name.  I didn't have time to try it out on this trip, but it seemed huge and well-equipped.  Ultimately what brought this hotel down from a 4 to a 3 was the lack of an executive / concierge lounge, although there is a nice breakfast buffet (free for Platinum members) to make up for it in the morning.

Stayed here to attend a wedding at Dana Point.  Centrally located between the coastal towns and the cities of Orange County it is mainly accessible by the 73 toll road.  The hotel is modern with a sleek lobby and very well apointed rooms.  Service was excellent from the moment we checked in and the comp buffet breakfast was great.  Never saw so many healthy looking people in any hotel, perhaps because of the large health club attached to the property.  Parking was in a structure across the front walkway and access to the adjoing towns was easy aftering figuring out the surface streets, freeways and toll road network.  The beach towns are about eight miles to the west and there seems to be a lot small retail and cafes between the hotel and Laguna Niguel.

We stayed here for one night for a weekend gateway. Bed was very comfortable and the hotel overall was very clean. Location is on a very safe area, and very quiet also right by the toll freeway.  My only con is the price. A bit on the expensive side at $179/night, but it seems to compete more with luxury hotels. There's a complete gym, however they close at 10 and we unfortunately had not had a chance to use it. Also parking is 10 dollars a night.   Overall thought a decent hotel. Will stay again if there are deals on our next visit.

Stayed three nights at this hotel in August - two adults and two kids ages 11 and 19. Was given requested connecting rooms by Joe - hotel manager. Service level was very high. Special thanks to Andrew - the bellman for his special attention to us while we were there.  As others have mentioned - this hotel has a first class gym attached. Nothing lacking there, from equipment to classes to sauna etc, it was top notch.  Hotel has two pools and a splash pad. Got a little crowded during the day - but that is expected.  Rooms were upscale, clean, and very comfortable. They have a modern feel. Bar/Coffee area in lobby is cool - well done.  I think one of the best things about the hotel is location, while it is in the beaches area - it is located an easy drive to Laguna Beach, very

We stayed here during a travel-baseball tournament in San Clemente (south). Not what we expected but def.top notch. Like another review it's hard to say if this is a health club with a hotel attached or a hotel with a health-sports-club theme. (the servers, house staff, etc. are in 'track suits').  Our room wasn't ready when promised but the outdoor patio area was fine to hang out in while we waited. (I think if they knew we were marriott rewards members it might have been ready...). When it was ready, the keys were delivered to us on the patio. One strange thing; you cannot get to the pool from the outdoor lounge.  You have to 'check in' at the fitness desk (?) to walk through to the pool. Maybe another company actually runs the fitness facilities. We are not fitness buffs so

I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel.  it is not the best hotel i have ever stayed at, but for a business travel hotel and for the price, it can not be beat.   Everyone will tell you that the health club and pool are the best you will ever find in a hotel that is not a luxury resort, and they are right.  The pool and gym are OUTSTANDING.  The rooms are very nice too.  Very comfortable and modern.    Happy hour in the bar is great, and there are good deals to be had there.  The staff across the board is top notch.  Front desk, wait staff at the restaurant/bar, gym staff and housekeeping.  Very, very good.  The restaurant is very health conscious and many of the dishes are less than 500 calorie.  I used to dread visiting Southern California for work, really only enjoying one of

This is our local business hotel and it doesnt disappoint.  Hotel is big clean and has decent amenities.  There is a spa, hair salon, huge gym and outdoor pool.  The rooms are large, decor leaves a bit to be desired but I get the sports theme.  Food is plentiful, portions are large and they even have <500 kcal options marked on the menu for the health conscious guests.  An evening on the verandah with the lanterns overlooking pool and jacuzzi and palm trees is very enjoyable, as is the pretty dependable weather which allows a post-work swim.   Hotel is walking distance to the local shops, cafes and cinema but few walk in California.  It took a few minutes to cross the 6 lane regular road (not even a highway) but I enjoyed the constitutional in 80 degree heat.  You will need a

Summary Heading: great even if you don't work out
Summary: I have stayed here several times and have really enjoyed it. Very clean sleek design. I was so busy I didn't have time to wokr out in the wonderful gym but my husband was very impressed.  The beds very comfy and the room spacious. I thought I had lost something at the hotel and they were very attentive to try and find it for me.

I have stayed here many times.  I have yet to be disappointed.  Room size is good.  Beds are very comfortable.  I like that there is a couch in the room because I tend to leave my suitcase open on it and repack the clothing I have worn to save time on packing up.  Bathroom is spacious and well appointed.  I do wish that the bath towels were stored closer to the shower though.  The temperature control in the rooms work great and are very responsive. Fitness facilities are definately a huge draw for this hotel from visiting guests to locals with a membership.  The bar and restaurant never disappoint...with one exception.  Breakfast service is very slow.  Okay if you are prepared.  And they don't put salt & pepper on the tables so you need to ask, but it seems that we dont realize
We love staying here.  Always great service and beautiful surroundings.

Had a very nice stay at this hotel, great healthy food for dinner, and amazing fitness center, which has a huge draw from the local community.  The fitness center was well run, clean, and more than enough equipment, with a great BB court and fitness classes, all free as a guest. Just 15 minutes from Laguna Nigel, a very comfortable, well run hotel.

This is a great hotel if you don't like to miss your workout while away from home for work or business.   Very trendy hotel that caters to your healthy side. If you are a guest in the hotel, you have access to the full gym and all classes.   Very nice pool area, breakfast buffet is wonderful, and the hotel staff were always courteous and willing to help.

This is a hotel in a health club or a health club in a hotel, hard to tell.  However, both are well done.  The hotel rooms are of good size and everything works.   Service people are very helpful and responsive in a California laid-back sort of way.  Every request was met with a positive reply and an eagerness to help.  The restaurant has a health club bent, so don't expect the usual fare.  This is actually good news.  If you're really hungry, just one more tapas and you should be fine.  The restaurant is very reasonably priced and the food is good.  The health club is fantasitc - all new equipment and although the club is large, it does not have the feel of a mega gym or the intimidation that comes with the usual men with bulging muscles.  On several occasions I saw the staff

Actually stayed for nearly two weeks for business (checked out for the weekend to go visit friends).  Had a small-ish room facing the parking garage with no chair in the room (other than the hard pull-up at the desk), but did get a nicer room overlooking the pool the second week (and, it had a small couch, hooray!).  The staff is great, very friendly and charming.  The breakfasts are fabulous and the bar is wonderful.  The best part would probably be the manager's reception on Monday evenings for elite members and the fabulous fire pits on the lanai.  But, I would recommend the hotel...

Summary Heading: Great vibe, great bar, great rooms
Summary: I have been traveling to Orange County regularly for the past four years and I typically stay at the Hilton by the airport because it is close to the airport.  A friend convinced me to try this hotel and I was not disappointed.  The key to this hotel is the gym and the bar.  Both are excellent.  When you are staying here you don't feel like you are traveling for business - the bar is actually quite lively, my guess is it is more locals that travelers, the deck is awesome and the gym is the main draw.  The rooms are great with one really irritating feature: they have motion sensitive lights, so if you wake up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom or change the setting on the thermostat, be prepared to be blinded by a light.  You can turn them off, but by then it is too

I was disappointed that when checking in they tried to put us in a yuccky standard guest room with no view which normally costs 159.00 a night when we paid for a junior suite king room at $239.00 a night. If I had not complained about the quality of the room we would not have been moved to the room that we had paid for. Check in staff need to be honest. I will never return or recommend this hotel because of this experience. Also the hotel advertises that rooms have a bath shower combo and 2 tvs. Our room did not have either of these and I was looking forward to a bath after being on the road for 8 hours. We did not get the daily newspaper they said we would get. We had to request a fridge 3 times. Once on our booking request form and twice at reception. The shower is useless. It
We needed to stay in Alsio Viejo.  The Renaissance ClubSport Aliso Viejo, a fairly new hotel was close to our family celebration. The rooms are large,comfortable and Quiet..

Summary Heading: I go out of my way to stay here
Summary: If life takes you to the OC, specifically south orange county, stay here.  The hotel is only a few years old.  The rooms are very comfortable (get one overlooking the pool/town). The rates are very competitive. The staff is excellent and the hotel is attached to one of OC's premier fitness clubs.  As a hotel guest you get full access.  I have no complaints.  If you're looking for a good dinner close by, check out Opah at the Aliso Viejo town center (1 mile away).  Great food and atmosphere.

We stayed in this hotel because it was the recommended hotel for guests of a wedding that we attended.  My first experience with this hotel was a positive one, having been able to obtain the special wedding guest rate even though I booked a little late.  Everything worked out well with the reservation, which truly increased my confidence in the hotel.    As it turned out, everything about our stay was excellent, from the  cleanliness of the hotel, the decor, the room size and the level of comfort.  The front desk staff was extremely friendly. We absolutely loved the breakfast in the restaurant which, although a little pricey, was so darned good we sat there for quite awhile enjoying ourselves. The service in the restaurant was excellent, too. We did not visit the health club (no

This hotel was top-notch in all aspects.  The hotel is very clean.  The rooms were spotless.  The decor was trendy.  The restaurant prices are steep but the food quality was great.  The hotel offers free Wi-Fi internet which was great for business on my laptop computer.  The availability of complimentary access to the fitness club and lap pool is an excellent amenity.  I took advantage eating right and staying in shape during my stay.  All of the staff greeted me with smiles in the lobby and throughout the hotel.  There is a local town center just down the road with restaurants, shops, retail, and movie theater.  Lots of variety.  I recommend this hotel to all staying in the area on business.  Check for a AAA or government rate if it applies.

Summary Heading: Made a family gathering for Christmas a relaxing time with our own space!
Summary: The Club had complete gym facilities, heated outdoor pool and Jacuzzi, and great breakfast buffet.  All family members from 17 to 67 found something they could do in the morning after breakfast together. Then plan activities in the afternoon or evening like visiting Laguna Beach, seeing Wicked in LA, and drinks at Ritz Carlton. Perfect! And did I mention the fire pit at the end of the day? Great for sharing family stories.

I was there on business for 2 nights.  The room was great, but nothing exceptional.  Dumbells in the bathroom tell you this is all about health and fitness. Great bar area and breakfast was really nice.  Complimentary gym access for hotel guests - but you are paying for it in your room rate.   I felt it was an overpriced hotel - but if you are really into your fitness then give it a try.

I have to tell you I have worked near this hotel many times and stayed in Costa Mesa NO MORE!  This is an amazing property.  I love it.  The service is great!  They have low calorie food which I love when you indulge too much this is a happy change of pace!  They rooms are spacious and the view is amazing!  They have valet parking (I do not do parking garages) and are very happy to get you anything your heart desires.  I did not use the gym as I came off a combined trip and did not have any workout clothes (I was gone 10 days with a 20" bag :(  I did have the sorbet it was unreal!  I recommend at least indulging on this at the end of the day.  It came in a martini glass and I was ready to lick the glass.  I will stay here again :)

I stay here quarterly.  Reception always goes smoothly.  I was disappointed that I was given two small beds instead of the king that I reserved and is on my Marriotts reward profile.  But that's the only complaint about the bed.....they are so comfortable!  Near impossible to not sleep well. Down stairs is always hopping.  I am disappointed in customer service. I left my phone charger pulled in by the nightstand.  I called as soon as I realized it.  It never showed up.  My fault for leaving it......but still.

I'm a Marriott fan and just stayed in this property for the first time. I will definitely return.  The hotel is modern, upscale, and clean. Room was normal for a Marriott family property, which means very nice with an excellent bed.  Modern and large bathroom.  As a lap swimmer I was thrilled to see the pool--a real pool with lap lanes.  The fitness club is included with your stay and is amazing.  Huge, lux locker rooms and all the equipment you could ask for. Great dinner service on the patio and a delicious breakfast buffet.

We have stayed here 4 times in 2 years, latest Sept. 2011. The health club is really an amazing facility and it's great to just go downstairs, work out on any piece of equipment you can imagine, then hit the coffee bar and sit outside with your java and outmeal. Rooms are very comfortable, and quiet. (Sometimes they have music by the pool, but it ends by 10PM.) Service has been very good, great from some individuals. Valet parking is $20, and service is fast.

Summary Heading: Amazing hotel stay for the fitness minded family
Summary: Its the facilities that make this hotel exceptional. It has a full service huge gym even with basketball court, lap pool etc. Kids are looked after. Too many facilities to name... Staff are nice. The place has a buzz especially on Friday nights. Easy access to Laguna Beach but sits in the hills behind the beach. Good food and shops nearby. Rooms are modern, normal size. Hotel is set on a hill and views inland are available. Breakfast buffet is good. Very pleasant to stay here.

Summary Heading: Great for Business  Great for Working Out
Summary: I recenlty stayed at the Renaissance Club Sport this past August for 7 days 6 nights.  The hotel sits in a very nice area of Aliso Viejo, it's clean, it's convenient to the freeways and beaches, and it has a great health club, pool, and spa.  My wife did a 80 minute deep tissue message and loved it.  She put the services at the spa in the same category as The Phoenician in Scottsdale.  Overall we were very pleased with the hotel fromt the check-in process to when we checked out.
Spacious rooms, self-park for $10/night, two pools. We did not take advantage of any of the spa offerings, but they are extensive. Very quiet environment inside the room.

Outside for the California sun – inside for the strong, bright, pure colors used in the décor.  The modern décor may well take getting used to by some, but it well fits the style of the hotel and its modern approach to a close association with a fitness club.  The club is a great hotel amenity and, I am sure, the reason that many road warriors will stay – especially given the commercial location of the property.  As everything is almost brand new there is little to comment on, except the staff.  To a person, from the valet, to the doorman, to the front desk person, to the room maid – all were friendly, smiling and seemed to genuinely enjoy their work and clearly value you as the guest.  Sleep quality was unusually high from a combination of a comfortable bed and the construction

The Aliso Viejo Renaissance Club Sport hotel is unlike any hotel I've stayed at before.  This is my second stay here, and both were long weekends while accompanying my husband while he is out here for work.  Basically the hotel is also a high end gym, and the hotel guests and the gym members share a number of the services the hotel offers.  There are benefits to this, but the approach needs some fine tuning. Rooms:   Rooms are very  nice and modern, though not exceptionally large, but adequate space.  Beds are comfortable, with lots of pillows and the bathroom is nice. Aveda products in the bathroom.  Some of the views are nice, others are of the parking garage.  Staff:  Everyone that works at the hotel is very pleasant, and they are all very accommodating.  Most of the staff

Summary Heading: I will definitely stay here again!
Summary: The staff is very friendly and helpful.  I loved the room - motion detected lighting, walk-in shower, nice work area.  The best thing is the attached health club.  It is a fabulous club with group classes, personal trainers, and new equipment.  The food at the hotel restaurant is excellent and is healthy - no french fries on this menu!  Two outdoor pools, nice outdoor patio, covered parking.  Convenient to the freeways and to the office.  Kind of hard to find the hotel unless you really know where you are going.  I usually stay in Dana Point, but this is my new preferred hotel near our Laguna office.  No concierge lounge but breakfast vouchers for the buffet for elite rewards members.

Summary Heading: A fantastic hotel with great facilities
Summary: My husband and I booked two nights here to celebrate our wedding anniversary. It is a great location to explore Laguna Beach. We were impressed by the modern room and the helpful staff. We ate in the hotel and were pleased by the healthy and fresh choices on the menu. It was a welcome relief after dreading a limited choice of American junk food.The outdoor swimming pool is great as are the spa facilities. The room we stayed in was spacious, very clean and with a  modern decor. The hotel is ideally located near shops and  range of restaurants,. Aliso Viejo itself is very quiet and seems more like a business park than somewhere for tourists. However the hotel is impressive and it is value for money compared to hotels closer to Laguna Beach.

Summary Heading: Great hotel.  Great customer service.  Can't wait to come back again!
Summary: Flight was delayed 4 hours and rental car took even longer to get....so needless to day I was pretty tired and cranky when I finally arrived after traveling for 11 hours.  Hotel is about 35 minutes south of Long Beach airport with a $6 toll right before the exit.  Hotel is located in a commercial area with no restaurants or anything close by.  I was even more annoyed to find out that I had to park in the parking deck and walk about 7 long minutes to the hotel.  When I got to the hotel I was greeted by a very nice bellhop who opened the door for me.  Once inside I was impressed by the modern design and setting of the lobby and restaurant/bar (Citrus Gril).  Doug checked me in and realized I was a bit cranky but he was very helpful and comforting.  He gave me free breakfast

This is a hotel with potential.  It is in a nice, quiet area.  The decor is modern and unique.  The Health Club is a pretty good one.  HOWEVER, at 3:00 am, when our room began to fill with an awful chemical stench, loud, grating sound and a haze of smoke, we imagined the manager might come up immediately instead of grumbling something nearly incomprehensible before asking what WE thought should be done.  We asked to have someone sent IMMEDIATELY, as we were certain that the A/C until was about to burst into flame.  We turned it off and waited for a FULL 15 minutes; eyes burning, throats burning, and nausea setting in (even with the door open).    The second call (where I said I thought I might need to call 911) got a tech to the room within 3 minutes.  The tech, who exclaimed,

Stayed here for one-night as pit-stop from Disneyland to San Diego.   Internet: Free, but incredibly slow, I gave up using it after it takes more than 10 minutes just to load an email Parking: Free Location: OK if you are driving, its in the middle of a commercial area.   We checked-in quite late, around 1am. Somebody asked us if we needed help when we arrived, and we kindly rejected. Then once we got everything out of the car, I went into the lobby for check-in. Clearly somebody know I was there, but I still had to wait awhile until someone eventually came out to help me check-in.   Room was very roomy. Only rain shower, no hand-held or bathtub. Design is quite modern for a Renaissance.   I didn't have a chance to visit the pool and gym, but I did see quite a few locals going

Summary Heading: Best Fitness Center / Gym of any hotel, period.
Summary: My wife and 2 boys stayed here in July for one night.  While it was a short stay, I did utilize the on site fitness facility.  This is not your typical hotel gym; this is a complete work-out facility utilized by non-hotel guests with a membership (similar to a Lifetime Fitness if you are familiar with them).  They have a full size basketball gym, multiple raquetball courts, free weights and many machines, plenty of treadmills and other carido devices.... etc, etc.  I picked this location as a good point between LA and Carlsbad as we planned to visit Legoland the following day.  The room was very clean.  I would go back.  If you like to work-out while on the road this place can't be beat.

Before you enter you are warmly welcomed outside by the professional bell staff. Once inside the feeling is bright, spacious and happy. The efficient  Front Desk is conveniently placed on the right side and coupled by the Health Spa Desk on the left.  You feel energized by the activity created by guests and locals who use the massive and immaculate gym/spa (w/a well-trained and willing to share staff) on two open levels complete with many available classes (pilates/yoga/strength training,etc) which hotel guests are invited to use free of charge during their stay. If you decide to cycle or run a treadmill upstairs you can overlook the mountains beyond the huge windows - awesome! The pools and sundeck are equally beautiful sitting next to the outside restaurant complete w/garden

Summary Heading: The coolest Renaissance ever! Hoops Heaven!
Summary: This is a very nice pool/health club with a hotel attached. I have to say, the business model is intriguing; mixing the California tradition of a pool club with a hotel. If you are a fitness buff, this is a great place to stay. It has a great gym-cardio, lap pool, family pool, weight room racquetball courts. It's not too far from the beach (20 minutes). It is near shopping/movie theaters. It is close to the toll road and the interstate (a very quick trip to John Wayne/Orange County Airport). It is also clean and well maintained and offers great value for this part of Orange County.  The highlight for me-it has a beautiful full basketball court!!!  The service was also incredibly friendly. The whole vibe of the place was healthy.  Drawbacks- this is a premium health club used by

Summary Heading: Nice club hotel with great rooms
Summary: The hotel was very nice and upscale. The room was a good size and the bed was wonderful. The bathroom was very nice with a large walk in style shower. The food was so so, but the atmosphere and the workout facilities were great.

I was pleasantly surprised at how clean this hotel was. The lobby and common areas are very well thought out, and the room was excellent. I'm a perfectionist, so the bathroom, beds, even hidden cordes were all in order. The bathtub was extremely deep, felt spa-like. It was 4:00 p.m. and cool out but the pools were heated enough to swim, which was awesome for the kids. Hotel is kid friendly, but also upscale. I'd stay here again for sure.

I stayed at this hotel for one night while I was in town for a wedding.  Very modern in the lobby/bar area.  Did not go out to the pool, and saw the gym from afar.  You get charged for parking EVERYDAY, whether it be $10 for self (good luck finding a spot) or $20 plus tip for valet.  Quite annoying.  We were supposed to get a roll out bed for the room along with the king size bed.  When it did not show up we contacted the front desk and they let us know there were no roll outs available, even though we had arranged it.  This hotel is definitely geared towards people my age looking to be at the "in" place to be.

We chose this hotel because of the gym facilities. When we arrived, we were pleasantly greeted by the valets. We decided to self park and they were OK with holding the car till we checked in. Everyone that we encountered during our stay were fantastic, smiling, communicative, and overall friendly. We checked out the gym facilities and they were beyond what we expected which made the stay that much better. We took one of the classes (some of the classes seem quite crowed) "Pilates with toys" and enjoyed it. Even though we were the new kids on the block, the instructor did not make us feel out of place. My wife decided to check out the spa and have a facial and she boasted that it was one of the best that she has had. After one of our workouts, we decided to try the restaurant,

This hotel is very nice.  FULL of folks working out.  Rooms are nice and comfortable.  Very clean.  I like the technology for the lights..motion detection.  Beds are very comfortable.  Shower is Huge!  Bar downstairs is hoppin'!

Marriott is  taking a new approach in the hotel industry. The Renaissance ClubSport Aliso Viejo Hotel has modern, earthy decor. The staff was very helpful with any questions and extremely pleasant. Our room overlooked the pool area and was spotlessly cleaned each day. The view from our room was beautiful especially at dusk when the sun was going down. The hotel was centrally located to the beaches or stay in the area for breathtaking views!If time allows ,use  the sports club facilities and pools.

Summary Heading: Comfortable and up-to-date with only minor flaws
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for two nights for a business workshop. It's one of the few times I haven't selected my own hotel when traveling, but it didn't disappoint. It looks fairly new all over (outside, lobby, restaurant, rooms), and the high point was the bed, which was very soft with lots of excellent pillows. I slept great. High marks for cleanliness except for a couple of stray hairs in the bathroom.  Honestly it's a bit strange that the hotel is fitness-themed -- there are even small barbells in the bathroom -- but it wasn't overwhelming. I didn't visit their large fitness center but could see it, as well as two pools and a hot tub, from my window.   My main complaint, and the reason I rated service four stars instead of five, is that I filled out the breakfast pre-order

I stayed here for the weekend with my husband.  Room was beautiful and food was great.  Also the healthclub was amazing.  Staff was amazing espially Chris at the front desk and Sara in the resturant.  They both went above and beyond for us and made us feel like we were staying at Four Seasons.  They are the definition of Customer Service.  The pool outside was also perfect and great for laps.

I travel to Aliso Viejo frequently for business and always stay at the Renaissance ClubSport. Conventiently located near my office, this hotel is a joy to visit. The rooms are large, beds are comfy, the bathrooms are huge. The fitness center is amazing and the outside bar/lounge has a cool, relaxing vibe. The menu in the restaurant offers healthy choices and there is Starbucks cafe with nice bagels, fruit and yogurts for breakfast. Wireless Internet is free.   The only minor disappointment is that there is no tub in the bathroom, and it would be great if the showers were a bit harder. Other than that, no compliants.   I don't know if I would stay here if I was on vacation, or visiting Orange County since it's a bit out of the way, but for business it's an excellent choice.

Summary Heading: This was a really nice place to spend the weekend
Summary: My family was in the area for a wedding in Aliso Viejo.  We had a number of rooms in the hotel and the staff couldn't have been nicer.  Initially we were spread out over the hotel, but after speaking with the desk, the rooms were changed so that everyone was on the same floor.  In addition, they waived the $10 parking fee (not sure why they have it.....i agree with earlier posters that this fee is annoying and should be eliminated).  The facilities were fantastic.  The gym was in the same building and it was great to just take the elevator down to the lobby and walk over to the gym.  The gym was a full service operation; classes, basketball and racquetball courts and almost every machine that you could think of to use.  I went to the gym three times over the weekend and had no

Summary Heading: Cool, comfortable hotel with fabulous fitness club.
Summary: We booked two nights, but ended up staying three, it was that good.  This hotel has everything you could want: INCREDIBLE fitness facility, appreciated even by the hopelessly unfit, like me.  Lots of free classes, large indoor basketball courts, free weights and machines, beautiful outdoor pools, hot tub, patio area with fire pit. The locker room is sparkling clean and I had the spotless sauna to myself. There is also an indoor whirlpool and hot tub.  Down the hill about half a mile is the Aliso Viejo town center mall - theatres, tons of restaurants and shops and a Ralphs. You can request a refrigerator for the room (no charge). The only downside:  a $10 self-park fee or $20 for valet, but the valets provided spectacular service:  Thanks for getting my glasses, Eric!   There was

Summary Heading: Great hotel with a fitness center attached
Summary: I don't mean the typical fitness center consisting of two or three treadmills and towels.  This is a complete, full-service gym, like Gold's or 24-hour.  I worked out there several times and enjoyed it very much.  The outside pools are nice.  The fire pit is a nice touch.  The hotel was very clean, and the service was good.  I didn't eat in the restaurant, so I can't report on that.  I got the opportunity to visit Knott's Berry Farm on the last day.  Xcelerator is a great rollercoaster.

Slowest internet connection I've ever experienced at a hotel.  Ten times slower than dial-up (3 kB/s).  Front desk confirms this is the case every night; there's one internet line shared by everyone in the hotel.  Rooms are clean modern.  Fancy connection dock for the TV (VGA, HDMI).  Beds are comfortable.  Bathroom is very spacious and modern, with free standing shelves but no cabinets or drawers.  Water pressure is excellent.  Digital temperature controls, cordless phone, flat screen TV, iPod dock on alarm clock.
Stayed for one night and was quite happy with the modern and clean environment.  Attached to a first class spa, plenty of free garage parking, great pool, etc.  Highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed at the Renaissance Club Sport for my boyfriends birthday.  We stayed 2 nights, one of the nights as Marriott Reward stay.  The staff were polite and helpful, the restaurant was great, they have healthy menu with a variety to choose from.  For desert I cinnamon gellato, which was yummy.  This hotel is tucked inside of a business park of the 73 toll road.  It has a huge fitness center, spa and activities for kids, I saw a few of the Nickelodeon characters on the property while I was there.  The rooms are spacious and immaculate, some have only showers ours had a huge tub and a shower.  They also have free wi-fi, though it's a bit slow.. who cares it's free.  This hotel is about 20 miles south of Disney Land and a few short mile from the beaches, they also have yoga,

The "welcoming" was very nice and the check-in was quick.  A couple of issues arose, which the staff handled quickly and professionally.  But I have to say that this hotel, for being a Renaissance, didn't have that glitzy, at-your-service feel.  Maybe my expectations were set higher.  The hotel grounds are kept clean, but are not stunning as other Marriott’s I’ve visited.  The housekeeping staff did not restock the soaps and lotions.  The location is great, it is less than a mile to Edwards movie theaters, several nice restaurants (Chilis, Macaroni Grill) pharmacy (CVS, Walgreens) grocery stores (Ralphs) and several other stores (Barnes and Noble, Starbucks, Barnes and Noble).  The gym is huge and state of the art.  I love to work out and this gym had equipment I'd never seen

Summary Heading: Loved this resort, can't wait to go back!
Summary: My family and I stayed here for a weekend getaway for my birthday. We loved everything about this resort.  We had a mountain/pool view room on the 4th floor. Room was nice, bigger then the average hotel room. Very clean and large bathroom. Made the stay with our two young children very comfortable.  We ate at their restaurant for the breakfast buffet every morning. Great buffet for the price! Made to order omelet station, waffle station, fresh fruit, eggs, bacon, potatoes, biscuits, gravy, yum!  This resort has a huge 25,000 square foot gym with everything you can imagine. The locals pay about a pretty price for their monthly membership, but I can see myself paying those kind of prices for the amenities.  You will see and meet many of the locals that belong to the gym club

Summary Heading: Nice but BAD BEDS AND ROOM SERVICE
Summary: Stayed here for 4 days.  The decor was nice but the beds were very uncomfortable.  The mattress was poor quality and had a feather duster on top.  The contoured sheet covered the duster but not the mattress.  The duster kept on shifting so we took it off the bed.  The duster stayed on the floor in the corner the entire visit although I asked for it to be removed.  The room was VERY DUSTY which was really bad for my allergies.  I had asked for a well dusted room when making the reservation but I was told no one on the staff even looked or were aware of my request.  I ended up dusting the room myself everyday.  ROOM SERVICE is a misnomer.  You can order it but it comes up to an hour later and then it is very cold.  The last day we figured out why.  We ate breakfast in the

We stayed here last January, the hotel had just opened 6 months prior.   I can't say enough of this place.   Very very nice, clean and very professional staff.   I need a computer ASAP and they quickly guided me to one... no added cost! The room was spacious, very neat and a beautiful decorated.  The view was okay, but we weren't there to look out the window.    The Hotel as a whole is very pro-health.   I just felt like going for a jog every morning even though I don't jog and eating the best I can eat.   This is a good thing! The Location.... well, make sure you have a car to get around.   There is a shopping area with lots of restaurants down the road a few blocks.  Not within walking distance, unless you are extremely motivated!!! I loved this hotel.... we travel a lot and

Summary Heading: Hotel is modern and nice.....but don't stay here!
Summary: Don't let the look of this modern and nice property fool you. Yes the decor is great and the room is comfortable and neat however they do cater to the locals and gym members than they do guests who are staying at the hotel.   Our room service was delivered late over an hour, no call was made until we called to see what was going on. When the food was finally delivered it was cold! We only stay at Marriott properties so this has never happened. When we called to see if we can get something resent the Manager Dana was not only inconsiderate she could care less. She said she would check into our order and call us back. WTF? We had to call her back because we wanted to leave since it was already cutting into our plans for the day....so instead we went downstairs to check out and

Stayed for a weekend with two teenage boys, 14 and 15. I asked for two rooms, one king and one double with extra pillows and towels...when I arrived, voila, not only was everything delivered but the rooms we're joined. This made life much easier. The stay was very pleasurable. The rooms are extremely comfortable with terrific bathrooms and a walk in shower. Alas, there is no fridge in the room, but a coffeemaker and fixens is supplied...but why bother when you can just go down teh elevator to the in-lobby coffe/juice bar! It's either a Coffee Bean or Starbucks...can't remember. In any case it very convenient.  Now the reality. This place is actually a huge, ultra-modern health club with a hotel attached to it. Everything is sports-oriented including the guestrooms. Our rooms had

Stayed the weekend here and it seemed a happening spot for the locals.The pools were full of what looked like club members and their mostly younger kids,they out numbered the hotel guests.On Friday night the bar and adjoining outside patio were packed.The resturant food was ok,room service delivered cold food.The fitness club is great,the locker room is top notch with nice lockers, fixtures,steamroom,jacuzzi,etc.The gym itself has raquetball,basketball,individual tv on most of the cardio equipment .Our room was nice,standard size with a great bathroom.if you like going to the gym this is a great place to stay.

Club Sport Aliso Viejo was a great hotel. Unique accomodations that give you the opportunity to play sports, swim and enjoy outstanding accomodations. Great place to have drinks and good proximity to beach and other sights. Service was excellent and you know people really care about taking care of guests and paying attention to detail. Great Get Away!

We are just back from here and I really have nothing but praise for this hotel. Everything is clean, bright and well thought out. Even the food served was fairly good for the type of menu. I think they may have given up some of the healthy part to the menu as it includes fries etc now. Even our grumpy teenage son seemed to enjoy here. There was a good "buzz" around the fire pits at night and it was very pleasant to set there and folks were very friendly. really the only thing I have a problem with in this review is we want to go back and I don't want it to get too busy!

Although I have not yet stayed at this hotel, I live in the neighborhood and had an emergency that required faxing in the middle of the night. When I called to see if I could use the business center, I was so impressed by the friendly and helpful reception I received from the employee who picked up the call. When I arrived, he was beyond helpful and accomodating, and made the whole situation so much easier to resolve.  I also had the chance to view the lounge area, which was beautiful (as I had also heard from friends). Even though I live close by I would love to stay here for a mini-getaway. The Renaissance Aliso Viejo seems to be a first-class resort across the board. And it seems the other reviews reflect that as well!

I stayed here on business during the first full week in December, 2008.  I have never had a more comfortable stay in all of the trips I've taken to the Aliso Viejo/Irvine area.  The staff was fabulous the room comfortable and modern.  I can't give higher marks to any hotel!

Summary Heading: Spacious modern rooms, excellent sport facilities, very attentive staff
Summary: Very clean big modern rooms and bathrooms. Excellent large exercise pool (olympic dimensions: 25m lane) with everything you need (incl. swim wear dryer!!). Very friendly and helpful staff (we were a little picky about our room and after the 3rd attempt to satisfy our needs we were offered a free breakfast for the inconvenience -- not that you try this on purpose, but it shows a positive attitude of the staff!). Go there!! The 14-mile-drive to Laguna Beach always pays off!

My wife and I stayed here because of the proximity to Laguna Beach, the value is unbeatable, we thouroughly enjoyed our stay. We also discovered new places we liked in Laguna Beach from driving in the "back" way.

I know that this property had it's pain when it first opened, like allot of new hotels. That said; they have got the bugs out and it's well worth the trip. I am in the hospitality business and can say I've seen it all until now. A totally unique experience and probably the blueprint for the future. Great staff from the reception desk to the Rooms Director and the locker room attendant to the Executive Chef. All first rate and the reason why they are now so successful. My fiance and I had a great massage preceded by an intense workout in the montruous fitness facility. Thanks to a professional courtesy we were upgraded to an Executive Suite. I recently returned from a 3 day weekend stay at Renaissance ClubSport Aliso Viejo Hotel. This hotel is amazing. They exceeded my wildest expectations. I travel every week for work, so I am able to experience many hotels throughout the country.  This is not a hotel for business travelers, but more appropriate for people looking for a relaxing get-a-way. I was greeted as soon as I pulled into the driveway to check-in. The customer service at this hotel is one of the best in the country that I have experienced. They called to follow-up on my requests, they greeted me by name and often left personal hand-written notes. In addition, the attached sports club is better than any gym I have ever been to. We had a perfect stay at the Renaissance ClubSport.  It is a new concept for Renaissance and I think it will be successful.  It is a combination of an amazing gym and outdoor pool facility, an excellent healthy restaurant with no entree over 485 calories and a very modern comfortable hotel.  There is also a nice bar and wonderful patio with firepits.  The staff was very friendly and couldn't do enough for you.  The bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom a nice size and the room was very well set up for business travelers.

Summary Heading: Modern stylish hotel with great facilities
Summary: A really nice hotel, may be the location wouldn't suit everyone as it's in the Laguna Hills but it's just up from Aliso Viejo towne center and a short drive to Laguna Beach, Newport Beach and Dana Point.  The hotel's facilities is where it scores well, if it's fintness facilities you want then this has to be the best facility in any hotel. This hotel really has style, it is very contemporary but hospitable too. The rooms are good size with a nice layout and great bathrooms with awsome showers. Staff around the hotel are friendly and helpful, the restaurant could have been a little larger but was adequate for breakfast, we didn't eat any other meal there so I cannot comment.  The pool are is great, plent of loungers and a great place to sit on the patio by the fire pits at night.

Am on the 2nd day of our 5 day stay. This hotel has everything I could want: INCREDIBLE fitness facility. Lots of free classes,  several LARGE (indoor) basketball courts, (squash courts?) , tons of free weights and machines, beautiful outdoor pools, hot tub, patio area with fire pit. The club/spa entrance on the left is separate from the hotel elevators on the right. I like having the opportunity to interact with "locals" and everyone at the fitness facility seemed incredibly nice and helpful (as do the hotel staff).  The locker room is sparkling clean and I had the spotless sauna to myself. There is also an indoor whirlpool and hot tub that I have not checked out yet. Down the hill about half a mile is the Aliso Viejo town center mall - theatres, tons of restaurants and shops

I’ve stayed at this hotel twice, once right after it opened this summer and then again recently. I’m glad I waited to post a review. During my first visit the property had just opened, it was summer time so there were tons families with kids running around. That was the biggest negative for me. I was drawn back to the hotel because it is so convenient, clean and the staff is attentive, but mostly because of the incredible fitness center. I hate working out in closet sized gyms that most hotels offer. The fitness center here has everything you could want; even the most ardent gym rat would love this place. Summary Heading: Great family hotel with awesome fitness facilities
Summary: We stayed at the renaissance over a weekend and thoroughly enjoyed our stay! The rooms were extremely modern and large - loved the white sheets with down duvet. The HD TV was a nice touch while we caught up on the olympics.   I loved how they threw in little things like free wireless internet and bath robes - other places nickle and dime you for things like that. We kept ourselves extremely busy with the fitness classes offered at ClubSport. We were amazed at how hi-tech the gym is - definitely the best we've seen. All the fitness instructors were awesome and we felt like we really got our money's worth.   The pool area was also very well done with lap pools and fun pools. From the description and concept of the hotel as stated on the web listing, we assumed that this hotel was marketed to busy professionals on the road, who wanted to maintain fitness and a healthy lifestyle while on the road.
